title: 13 Times When Movies Accidentally Twinned
desc: A movie is made by many minds but sometimes, co-incidences or lazy writing give us two very similar products. Here are 13 examples of films that twinned. The prodigious nature of the entertainment industry opens up the scope for diverse perceptions regarding the same concept. However, these perceptions often still culminate in what are known as â€œtwin films,â€ where the movies made bear similar plots and are released at a similar time. Churchill and The Darkest Hour are instances of this phenomenon. Surprisingly, this list of examples is longer than we would have imagined at first. For throughout history there have been plenty of such occasions, including the involvement of some of the biggest studios and star-casts.

posts.title: Showgirls / Striptease (1995/1996)
posts.content: Chasing her dancing dream in Showgirls, Nomi (Elizabeth Berkley) arrives in Las Vegas and pushes her way to the top of the ladder. However, a string of events teaches her some harsh lessons. Demi Mooreâ€™s Striptease, released just the next year is vaguely similar; needing money for a legal battle, Erin Grant becomes a dancer at a strip club, thus starting a chain of unfortunate events.

posts.title: The Matrix / eXistenZ (1999)
posts.content: A sensational watch even to this day, The Matrix explains how Neo faces off against a complex artificial intelligence system that has manipulated the reality around him. Released less than a month after Reevesâ€™ hit, eXistenZ also involves the distortion of reality via a VR game. Lines blur as a game developer and her publicist enter the game, resulting in more than one death.

posts.title: Red Planet / Mission to Mars (2000)
posts.content: In both movies, the search for extraterrestrial life leads astronauts to Mars, where theyâ€™re confronted with startling discoveries and harsh realities. Val Killmerâ€™s Red Planet, however, didnâ€™t perform very well with many citing the movie to be too slow. Mission to Mars, meanwhile, has its share of mystery and far more satisfied viewers as Luke Graham and Co. encounter a dome-shaped structure that kills almost everyone.

posts.title: Chasing Liberty / First Daughter (2004)
posts.content: The romantic comedies explain the efforts of the daughter of the US President, as she tries to gain some freedom from Secret Service agents. In both movies, the daughter falls in love with a boy, who later turns out to be an agent himself. Chasing Liberty has Mandy Moore and Matthew Goode in lead roles, whilst First Daughter stars Katie Holmes and Marc Blucas.

posts.title: Capote / Infamous (2005/2006)
posts.content: Hitting cinemas just one year apart, both these movies delve into Truman Capoteâ€™s research for his book, â€œIn Cold Blood.â€ Capote, which stars Philip Seymour Hoffman gives the viewers a broad glimpse into the mind of the author and the ongoing investigation, while the Toby Jones-starrer Infamous has a more personal outlook of Capote in the decade he wrote the novel.

posts.title: The Illusionist / The Prestige (2006)
posts.content: Webbing spectators with his magical prowess, Eisenheim (Edward Norton) pulls the wool over multiple pairs of eyes in the present as his lover was seemingly murdered by the Crown Prince of Leopold. The Prestige, released two months later, narrates how two extraordinary magicians and once-dear friends become obsessed with trying to destroy the other at all costs. Both movies require a suspension of disbelief on the audienceâ€™s part.

posts.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop / Observe and Report (2009)
posts.content: Working as a mall security guard, Paul takes his job very seriously but without much reward. His moment of reckoning arrives when thugs take hostages in the mall, thus unleashing the lion within him. Observe and Report is closely related but doesnâ€™t have the comic timing of its predecessor and unlike Paul, Seth Rogenâ€™s character Ronnie Barnhardt comes across as bumbling and unstable, rather than just silly.

posts.title: 2012 / Knowing (2009)
posts.content: Writer Jackson Curtis and Dr. Adrian Helmsley discover an impending danger that could destroy all life on Earth. Helmsley scrambles the news across to the US President, while Curtis attempts to rescue his family. The Nicolas Cage-starrer, Knowing, is somewhat similar wherein an MIT professor attempts to avert the global catastrophe, in the form of a solar flare, predicted by a time capsule.

posts.title: Friends with Benefits / No Strings Attached (2011)
posts.content: Will Gluckâ€™s Friends with Benefits explores how best friends, Dylan (Justin Timberlake) and Jamie (Mila Kunis) add casual sex to their existing equation after tiring of their search for true love. The Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher movie No Strings Attached treads around similar waters, and was in fact, originally titled Friends with Benefits but later changed to avoid any clash.

posts.title: Snow White and the Huntsman / Mirror Mirror (2012)
posts.content: Both these fantasy dramas revolve around an evil queen who attempts to destroy the only threat to her throne, Snow White. Mirror Mirror hit the screens earlier and features Julia Roberts, Lily Collins, and Armie Hammer in leading roles. Snow White and the Huntsman stars Chris Hemsworth and Kristen Stewart. It performed well at the box office and was popular among audiences.

posts.title: After Earth / Oblivion (2013)
posts.content: Set in post-apocalyptic times, After Earth and Oblivion feature heroes who must defy odds to complete their seemingly-impossible missions. The former places Will and Jaden Smith as the father-son duo stranded on the now-hostile Earth. Tom Cruise is the leading player in Oblivion and repairs the network of combat drones, until recurrent dreams and clues found lead him to embark on a revolutionary mission.

posts.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice / Captain America: Civil War (2016)
posts.content: Separated by just over a month, DC and Marvel released their own versions of a massive conflict between legendary heroes. Dawn of Justice came out first, featuring mind-blowing action sequences but not enough punch in the plot to make it a box office success. Civil War saw tensions between the Avengers blow through the roof, forcing heroes to take sides in an evenly-matched battle.

posts.title: Rough Night / Girls Trip (2017)
posts.content: Possibly inspired by Sex and the City, Rough Night and Girls Trip are both about a group of girlfriends, who learn a great deal about themselves and their relationship while on vacation. The former revolves around a bachelorette gone horribly wrong, while the latter features the leads dealing with a whole lot of drama involving partners and careers.

 Staying home isn't what we thought it would be. As much as we would all like to live the â€œNetflix and chillâ€ life, social isolation can dampen our morale. While it blows to cancel all the trips that we planned to take and see our bucket list gather a new layer of dust, the cloud of uncertainty is what is more disheartening. We know that a lot of you look for inspirational quotes to get you through quarantine, and so the least we can do is collate a list of quotes to help you get through this pandemic.

title: 15 Movies on Netflix That Are Perfect for Your Kids
desc:
Are you lost amidst an array of kids' movies online? Chill out, Netflix has you covered, with 15 films to keep them entertained during these trying times.
 
 Tons, tons, and tons are the number of streaming platforms from which to pick a good kids movie. Are they good? The only way to find out is with a bit of R&D on the three W's, and boy, do we know how long that's going to take. But we've got a smarter way to avoid all of that research because we've already been there, done that. All you need to do is, hop onto a Netflix subscription and let your kids watch or binge-watch these 15 movies that are sure to keep them entertained.

posts.title: Back to the Future - I, II, III (1985)
posts.content: Step into the past with the Back to the Future trilogy. Your kids will love it, so will you. We gotta say, listening to Doc's "Great Scott," or Marty's time travel in the DeLorean are things we would never forget. Fun Fact: the trilogy was so popular that even Ronald Reagan couldn't help but quote, "Where we're going, we don't need roads," in his 1986 State of the Union.

posts.title: The Croods (2013)
posts.content: This is another movie that blasts you into the past, but this time, the actual stone-age. This 2013 animated release, directed by Kirk DeMicco and Chris Sanders, tells us how a caveman and his family venture through uncharted territory, with a stranger they meet along the way, to find a new home. The kids are sure to enjoy and giggle through several parts of this out-of-this century movie.

posts.title: Stuart Little (1999)
posts.content: Who knew E.B. White's first book in 1945, would transform into an American family, live-action, adventure-comedy film? Your kids are going to love watching this charming "Little" mouse trying to fit in with a typical family. "Little high, little low! Little hey, little ho" Oh, that's just the Littles' tiny way of â€¦. Wellâ€¦ no spoilers here, watch the movie and find out. Psst, there's a sequel too.

posts.title: Chicken Little (2005)
posts.content: Ever watched a chicken fight aliens? You're in luck; this movie brings precisely that piece of the action. It all starts when a courageous chicken (that's a first) attempts to rescue his friends after he discovers an alien invasion on Earth is in order. Ask your kids to count the feathers on Chicken Little; it seems the crew put 250,000 on the tiny movie character. (Mind Blown)

posts.title: The Incredibles 2 (2018)
posts.content: You've probably graduated and taken up a job since the prequel, but you can't miss such an incredible movie (pun intended). Loved how the family takes on the supervillain syndrome in part one? Then you're going to adore the prequel, especially the kids. Bonus, watch Jack-Jack, the baby, explore more superpowers this time. And can you guess the superhero who says, "Where's my Super Suit?"

posts.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang (1968)
posts.content: If you have some favorite movie tunes stuck in your head, this musical-adventure film should be on your list. Notice Chitty, the broken-down Grand Prix car, turn into a fancy flying vehicle? There wasn't just one car, but seven of them: a worn-out one, a restored one, a flying model, a water model, and three partial models for minute scenes. That's a lot of cars for the 1960s.

posts.title: Space Jam (1996)
posts.content: Show your kids the cartoons of the olden days, which made you tick. Watch this animated-comedy sport with your kids and relive those childhood memories. Nothing can be better than some good old Looney tunes ft. Michael Jordan. While you do so, here's a cool fact, Warner Bros. built a basketball court for the dribble star, as a goodwill gesture, while filming.

posts.title: The Angry Birds Movie 2 (2019)
posts.content: We are sure we can hear Red go, "Started from a game, now we're here." If you owned a smartphone back in 2010, you know about the insane slingshot gameplay from Rovio. This is one of the chosen few games to have made to the movie screens. Just like the game, this movie maintains the tradition of the flightless birds thrashing cunning green pigs, without you orchestrating the slingshot.

posts.title: Kung Fu Panda 2 (2011)
posts.content: Everybody loves the furry, lazy, yet energetic panda, Po. So gather your family in the dojo you call a living room, order some momos, and "Roll the Panda" movie. Whereas in part 1, Po puts away the power-hungry crouching tiger, in part 2 he along with the Kung Fu team stops an evil Peacock from conquering China. Once you've watched the movie, ask your kids who their favorite characters are.

posts.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa (2008)
posts.content: "Just smile and wave boys, smile, and wave." Yes, the cute little decisive penguins are back. This is a sequel to 2005's Madagascar, where Marty, Alex, Melman, and Gloria, the zoo animals, attempt to get back to right where it all started. But, the plan goes south, and four party-animals crash lands in an African nature reserve. Ask your kids to name these animals.

posts.title: Turbo (2013)
posts.content: The Fast and Furious franchise is cool, but have you ever heard of fast snails? Meet Turbo, a slow-as-the-day garden snail, who, after a freak accident, may win the Indy 500, his dream circuit race. Directed by David Soren, Turbo is not just about showing kids the fictional perspective of racing but about dishing out loads of positive messages.

posts.title: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory (1971)
posts.content: If you and your kids have a sweet tooth, this classic musical family-fantasy, based on the book by good old Roald Dahl, should top your bucket list. Hop into a sugar-rushed journey about a boy who finds a golden ticket to a tour inside Willy Wonka's chocolate factory. Kids, you better not forget to brush your teeth after enjoying this treat.

posts.title: Klaus (2019)
posts.content: Ho, ho, ho, with this movie, Netflix proves it doesn't have to be Christmas to watch a holiday original. If you're a fan of hand-drawn animation, you're going to love watching Klaus and Jesper's acts of kindness work new wonders for the once cold town of Smeerenburg. And owing to its unique animation style, Klaus landed the Academy Award for the best animated feature film this year.

posts.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (2018)
posts.content: Tobey Maguire, Andrew Garfield, and Tom Holland have pulled off their roles, as Spidey, beautifully in each of the live-action Spider-Man films. The 2018 animated film's storyboard reeled the spider crossing paths with five renditions of itself, which was mind-blowing. Here's a cool fact, if you hit pause every time a train goes by, you will see an animated Stan Lee, added as a tribute to the comic-book writer.

posts.title: Ralph Breaks the Internet (2018)
posts.content: Here's a movie that's hit the internet six years after the prequel. It all starts when Ralph and Vanellope find a WiFi router in their arcade that sets them off on a brand new adventure. Even here, you can find an avatar of a silent Stan Lee while the two travel through the internet. This animated adventure deserves to be cast onto your television screen.

title: 15 Sure-fire Recipes to Ace While in Quarantine
desc: With the world practicing social-isolation amid the COVID-19 pandemic, most of us have been urged to work from home. As it turns out, self-isolation is proving to be quite wearisome. Thereâ€™s not much we can do within the confines of our homes, especially with the limited resources we have to feed ourselves. This whole ordeal, of course, is turning out to be quite the task for many. For those of us who are just bored with eating the same meal every day, here are some of the best recipes thatâ€™ll satisfy the tummy and soul.

posts.title: Beef roast soup
posts.content:
This one is a blend of a few simple ingredients to create the yummiest soup that is sure to satiate your family. You will need:Â
  • 6 to 8 potatoesÂ
  • Beef roast cut in small cubes (beef tips and ribs will also work)
  • 2 cans of tomatoes
  • 1 lb onions
  • Water as per requirement (if you like it thick and creamy, use less water)
  • Chilli powder
  • Salt and pepper (as per your requirement)
  • Half tablespoon of sugar
How to make it:Â Start by cooking the beef in the sauteed onion and tomato mixture. Deglaze the pan by adding some water and cook the beef on medium-high heat. Once it is tender, add the potatoes and spices. To make this dish more wholesome, you can serve it with some cornbread and ta-da! Courtesy: Quarantine Cooking and Survival via Facebook

posts.title: Burrito casserole
posts.content:
Who said a burrito and a casserole cannot be best friends? Check this one out for some fusion inspiration. You will need:Â
  • 1 can cream of condensed mushroom soup
  • 1 diced onionÂ
  • 1 packet taco seasoning
  • 1 can green chili peppers
  • 1 lb ground beef
  • 1 cup of corn
  • 10-12 tortillas(strips)
  • 1 can of refried beans
  • 1/2 cup sour cream
  • 2.5 cups shredded cheese
How to make it: As the oven preheats to 350 F, cook the onions and beef before adding the refried beans and taco seasoning. Next, cook the soup, sour cream, and green chilies together. Put half of the soup mix at the bottom of a casserole dish and top this with some tortillas, half of the ground beef mixture, corn, and a whole cup of cheese. Repeat each layer and finish it with cheese on the top. Bake this for 20 minutes until the cheese is utterly bubbly and delicious. Courtesy: Quarantine Cooking and Survival via Facebook

posts.title: Nutella sandwich
posts.content:
Thereâ€™s nothing more scrumptious and heavenly than a dollop of nutella on a crispy rice cake. You will need:Â
  • Chocolate flavored rice cakes (as much as you want)
  • Nutella chocolate spread
  • Undying love for chocolate and rice cakes
How to make it:Â Walk into the kitchen. Place the rice cakes on a plate and use a knife to spread generous amounts of nutella on them. Proceed to fit the entire cake in your mouth in one go. Munch munch and hmmmâ€¦!Â Courtesy: Nutella

posts.title: Corn dog muffins
posts.content:
Corn dog muffins are extremely moist, nummy, with a perfectly fluffy texture. These poppable bites are great for pretty much every occasion. You will need:Â
  • 1/3 cup of milk
  • 1/4 cup of sugar
  • 2 packs of corn-kits
  • 2 eggs
  • Hot dogs
  • 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese
How to make it:Â Start by preheating the oven to a steady 400 F. Mix the cornbread, eggs, sugar, milk, and cheese. Before you fill the muffin tray, ensure that you spray it with oil, butter, or ghee. Make sure that you are not adding too much batter or itâ€™ll overflow while baking. If youâ€™re using a mini-muffin tray, bake for 12-13 minutes, and if youâ€™re using a large tray, then bake them for about 14-15 minutes. Courtesy: Holly's Cheat Day

posts.title: Jambalaya
posts.content:
Jambalaya makes for a flavorful and easy weeknight meal. A classic Louisiana-origin dish, this recipe is loaded with rich flavors and spices. You will need:Â
  • 2 cubed chicken breasts
  • 2 tablespoons of butter
  • 3 cloves of minced garlic
  • 1 sliced link of sausageÂ
  • 1/2 a diced onion
  • 2 cups of chicken stock
  • 1 cup of beef stock
  • 2-3 stalks of diced celery
  • 2 cups of rice
  • 1 can of diced tomatoes
  • Cajun seasoning
  • Chili powder
  • Soy sauce
  • Worcestershire sauce
How to make it: Once your pot is hot, add the butter and cook the chicken and sausage to your liking. Throw in the celery and onion and sautÃ© until soft. Add the garlic and cook for a minute. Now, add in the flavoring and stir well. Once the spices are nicely cooked, throw in the tomatoes, rice, and stocks. Stir to make sure that the rice is not clumpy. Now, set your pot to manual and let it cook for a decent 10 minutes. Let it cool off, and then bite in.Â Courtesy: Terri via Allrecipes.com

posts.title: Stock potato soup
posts.content:
This soup is easy, creamy, fresh, heavenly, and perfect for a filling meal. A large stock of this will last you for days; so, dig in!Â You will need:Â
  • Tons of meat bones and scraps
  • PotatoesÂ
  • Heavy cream
  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Cayenne pepper
  • Chives or scallions (as toppings)
How to make it:Â Step one is to make a stock of the leftover meat bones and scraps. Next, dice the potatoes, add them to the stock and let them simmer till theyâ€™re soft. Blend this mixture and add a full cup of heavy cream. For taste, add salt, black pepper, and a pinch of cayenne. For toppings, add chives or scallions or both. Courtesy: Delia Online

posts.title: Vegetable potato soup
posts.content:
If youâ€™re bored with the aforementioned soups, then this oneâ€™s for you! This one is a rich blend of creamy potatoes, garlic, and lots of spice. If youâ€™re the health-conscious kind, you can, of course, swap the potatoes with sweet potatoes. What you need:
  • Chopped onions
  • Chicken/vegetable stock
  • Chopped garlic
  • 1 tablespoon of curry paste
  • Butter
  • Salt
  • Wine
  • Soy salt
  • Cayenne pepper or hot sauce
  • Cheese
  • Diced potatoes
  • Heavy cream
How to make it: Start by sautÃ©eing the chopped onion and garlic in ridiculous amounts of butter, and then add a tablespoon of curry paste. Once cooked, add the diced potatoes and simmer it in the stock of your choice. Lastly, add salt, and peppers. Donâ€™t forget to throw in the cheese(cheddar works best)! Now, enjoy this delicious soup and thank us later!Â Courtesy: The Spruce Eats

posts.title: French briocheÂ
posts.content:
Try this French bread if youâ€™re looking for something new and miss eating fancy food. You will need:
  • 4.5 teaspoons of yeast
  • 1/2 cup milk
  • 2 teaspoons of salt
  • 18 oz flour
  • 4 eggs
  • 8 oz butter
  • 1/3 cup of sugar
How to make it: Preheat the oven while you mix the flour, yeast, sugar, and salt in a mixing bowl. Add all the wet ingredients and mix the dry and wet ingredients well. Add 4 oz of butter before you knead the dough and add 4 oz of butter again when you put the dough back into the mixing bowl. Once the dough is ready, cover it with plastic wrap and leave it for some time. Once it is nice and fluffy, cut it into three equal pieces and braid them into one piece. Brush on some egg wash before putting it into the oven at 490 F to get a beautiful brown color. Bake it for around half an hour, and after all this effort, enjoy the delicious bread!Â Courtesy: Chef Romain Avril via Instagram

posts.title: Creamy omelet
posts.content:
Eggs are beautiful things. Theyâ€™re versatile and you can cook them in so many ways and more. To jazz up your breakfast routine, we added a twist to this omelet recipe. You will need:Â
  • 3 eggsÂ
  • Some olive oil
  • SaltÂ
  • ButterÂ
  • Mushrooms
  • Spinach
  • Garlic
How to make it:Â This omelet is by far one of the easiest recipes on this list. Sautee the garlic and add the mushrooms and spinach. Pour in the egg mixture on a preheated pan and keep stirring to ensure that it does not burn. Once the bottom cooks, add in a few pieces of butter and let it cook before rolling it onto your plate. Cut in the middle for maximum aesthetic and proceed to eat.Â Courtesy: Chef Romain Avril via Instagram

posts.title: Dalgona coffeeÂ
posts.content:
People on the Internet are going gaga over this coffee. Donâ€™t forget to try this out. Oh, might we add, please be ready for a sore and throbbing hand by the time youâ€™re done whipping the mixture. You will need:Â
  • 2 tbsp of sugarÂ
  • 2 tbsp of instant coffee
  • 2 tbsp of hot water
  • Â½ cup cold milkÂ
  • Ice
How to make it:Â Add the coffee, sugar, water to a mixing bowl and beat the mixture like nobodyâ€™s business. Once you notice that itâ€™s pale and frothy, add to a glass filled with cold. Voila! Your Dalgona coffee is ready! Courtesy: BBC UK Food

posts.title: Totchos
posts.content:
If youâ€™re bored of making elaborate dishes, this oneâ€™s for you! Totchos are crunchy, delectable, and surprisingly full of flavor. You will need:
  • 2 cups of shredded cheddar cheese
  • 1 bag of tater tots (approx 32 oz)
  • 6 slices of bacon (cooked and crumbled)
  • 1/2 cup of cooked and chopped chorizo or smoked sausageÂ
How to make it:Â Preheat the oven to 450 degrees and start by lining a large baking pan with parchment paper. Place the tots in a single layer and bake for about 20 minutes. Top this with bacon, sausage, and cheddar cheese and bake for an additional 5 minutes or till the cheese has melted. Remove this from the oven, add any toppings of your choice and serve hot. Courtesy: Spend With Pennies

posts.title: Fish stick tacos
posts.content:
When youâ€™re pantry is running out of fresh foods, go back to the frozen foods tucked away in your freezer and whip up some delicious tacos!   You will need:
  • 15 corn tortillas
  • Fish sticksÂ
  • Chopped cilantro
  • 1 cup sour cream
  • 2 teaspoons ground cumin
  • 1 package angel hair coleslaw, salted and sprinkled with lime juice
  • Canola or olive oil spray
  • Lime wedges
  • 1 tablespoon diced jalapeno pepper
  • 1 tablespoon chopped cilantroÂ
  • Juice of 1 lime
  • Salt
  • Black pepper
How to make it:Â Heat the fish sticks and set them aside. Place the tortillas on a baking sheet and spray them with oil on both sides. Bake these for 3-4 minutes on each side and sprinkle the cabbage with lime juice and salt. Set this aside and throw in some cumin, jalapenos, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper into the sour cream. Now, assemble the tacos. Stuff your face with this tasty meal! Courtesy: The Food Charlatan

posts.title: Meatball sliders
posts.content:
These absolutely delish meatball sliders will have you going back for seconds. Theyâ€™re savory, flavorful, and filled cheese.   You will need:Â
  • Sauce of your choiceÂ
  • Shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 2 tablespoons of olive oil
  • 12 slider buns
  • 3 tablespoons of Parmesan cheese
  • 12 cooked meatballs
  • 1 tablespoon of Italian seasoning
How to make it:Â As you preheat the oven to 350Â°F, put the buns on a dish. Spread the sauce on each bun, then place a meatball and cover it with mozzarella cheese. Brush these with olive oil. Mix the Parmesan cheese with the Italian seasoning for seasoning. Use a foil to cover the dish and bake it for 10 minutes. Remove the foil and bake it for another 10 minutes. Thatâ€™s it! Courtesy: Home Made Interest

posts.title: Ravioli lasagna
posts.content:
If youâ€™re up for making something extravagant but realize that your pantry is understocked, then this oneâ€™s for you. What you need:Â
  • 24 ounces of marinara
  • 1 small diced onion
  • 1 pound of ground beef
  • 1 large egg
  • Â¼ cup of Parmesan cheese
  • Â¼ cup of chopped parsley
  • 2 cups of shredded mozzarella
  • Â½ teaspoon of onion powder
  • 25 ounces of frozen cheese ravioli
  • 3 cloves of minced garlic minced
  • 2 cups of ricotta cheese
  • 1 teaspoon of garlic powder
  • minced parsley
How to make it:Â Start by preheating the oven to 350 degrees. Spray a baking dish with oil and heat a large skillet over medium heat. Then, throw in some ground beef and chopped onion. Cook till the beef crumbles. Add the marinara sauce and garlic and leave this mixture to simmer for about 5 minutes. As the sauce simmers, mix the ricotta, egg, Parmesan, parsley, garlic and onion powder in a small bowl. Spread out â…“ of the meat mixture on the baking dish. Top this with a single layer of ravioli, Â½ of the ricotta mixture, andÂ 1/3 of the sauce. Repeat this for each layer. Sprinkle this with shredded mozzarella and cover it with a foil. Bake this for 40 minutes before removing the cover and baking it for 10 more minutes. Let the meal set for 10 minutes before serving. Courtesy: Buns In My Oven

posts.title: Poutine fries
posts.content:
Are you bored of eating normal fries? Well, add some gravy to it! You will need:Â
  • 1/2 cup white cheddar cheese curds or cubed white cheddar cheese
  • 4 cups of frozen fries
  • 1/4 teaspoon of pepper
  • Brown gravy mix
How to make it:Â Prepare the gravy mix and add some pepper. Place the fries on a plate and top these with cheese and the yummy gravy. Courtesy: Taste of Home

title: 15 Train Trips that Should be on Your Travel Bucket List
desc:
Explore the breathtaking landscapes and terrain of the US with these luxurious train trips across the country and you will never book an air ticket again!
 
 
 
 Our country is riddled with landscapes and valleys that look like a painting come to life. The best way to rendezvous and appreciate its natural beauty is to travel. And what better way to explore the country than traveling in an old-timey, dreamy railway journey. However, since our travel plans are put on hold indefinitely, we might have to wait until we can journey through the vastness of beauty in the country. In the meantime, take a look at these 15 train trips you can plan in the future.

posts.title: All aboard to the mountain train
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

#cascadetrain #durangocolorado

A post shared by Micky Carr (@micky.carr) on Dec 26, 2016 at 6:30pm PST

Witness the spectacular sunlight bouncing on the Cascades ranges. The train trip originates from Eugene, Oregon, and runs parallel to the Cascade mountain range, all the way through Portland, Seattle, and finally, Vancouver.

posts.title: Surfs up!
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Coastinâ€™ #PacificSurfliner ???? by @dtrr_photography

The Pacific Surfliner is one of the most pocket and budget-friendly train trips you can board. It journeys along the Southern California coastline, stopping at small cities and towns, making the three-hour journey a treat to the eyes.

posts.title: From tall skylines to the land of maple
posts.content:

Some #trainviews from the northbound #Amtrak #AdirondackTrain today. Iâ€™m reflecting on these beautiful scenes in memory of Jim and Zack. #traintravel

For less than $100, the Adirondack train takes 11 hours from the hustling-bustling New York City to the land of the Maple leaf, Montreal, Canada. It takes you through the most beautiful trails of the United States.

If you miss the train I'm on, you will know that I am gone .... The Amtrak Sunset Limited between Van Horn, Texas and Marfa, Texas rolls out of a pastel sunset.. . . . . . . . . . . . . .@marathonmotel @visitmarathontexas @visitalpinetx @visitfortdavis @marfapublicradio @visitmarfa @visitbigbend @guadalupemountainsnps @visitbigbend #chihuahuandesert #marfatexas #marathontx #fortstockton #fortdavis @junkgypsy #monahanssandhills @txstandard @texastourism @livetexan @texasbootcompany #monahans #amtrak #amtraktrain #sunset #sundown #twilight #goldenhour #goldenhours #sunsetlimitedtrain #sunsetlimited #texaseagle #amtraktexaseagle amtraksunsetlimited

posts.title: Diversity on a narrow gauge
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

More of SP18 putting on a show. #durangocolorado #durangoandsilvertonnarrowgaugerailroad #colorado #nikond850 #dsngrr #steamtrain #everything_transport #visitdurango #trb_express #trains_worldwide #dodurango #kings_transport #pocket_rail #daily_crossing #coloradolive #coloradophotography #durangotrain #railsofamerica #railsupremacy #mydurangotrainmoment #railways_of_our_world# #slimprincess #sp18 #southernpacific

The Durango and Silverton Narrow Gauge Railroad lets you witness the diverse landscape in the country. Feel like a timeless traveler with this trip, as the steam engine train goes from the barren deserts to the snow-covered mountains of Colorado.

posts.title: Time travel on the Alaskan route
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Still the coolest train ride I've ever taken???????? Happy Saturday!

The vintage White Pass & Yukon Route trains with oaky interiors run between Skagway, Alaska, and Whitehorse, Canada. Riddled with lakes, mountains, and glaciers, the train trip is worth adding to your bucket list. The trip can also be combined with hikes and overnight camping.

One of the most iconic train trips of our country, the California Zephyr crosses numerous terrains, from rocky mountains like the Sierra Nevada to flat plains further. Explore the beautiful vastness by taking the cross-country trip between San Francisco and Chicago.

Southbound Amtrak Coast Starlight 11 passes by the Arroyo Hondo Vista Point after meeting Union Pacificâ€™s Officerâ€™s Special with 1111 leading just up the rails at the Gaviota Siding!!! @amtrak #amtrak #amtk55 #coaststarlight #gaviotacoast #passengertrain #daily_crossing #pocket_rail #railsupremacy #railfan_features #pacificocean #afternoon #ipulledoverforthis

If you wish to travel the entire West Coast in under $100, hop on to the Coast Starlight. This luxurious train showcases the beautiful seacoast between Los Angeles and Seattle in less than 35 hours.

posts.title: Smoky all the way
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Looking for a romantic, yet unique experience for your loved one? Check out Smoky Mountains Railroad â€œuncorkedâ€ Rail Line and Wine experience. It will fuse the adventure of railroading with the love of good wine and good company. About This Trip Passengers will enjoy a full service All-Adult First Class ride in our First Class cars with a private attendant and plush, well-appointed dining seating. A narrator will accompany the ride to present each pour to guests and share knowledge and history of the wines selected. Passengers on this specialty car will enjoy an exclusive sampling of cheeses and a surf and turf meal prepared fresh. We have carefully selected our wine samples to accompany the meal. All passengers will receive a GSMR souvenir stemless wine glass, four samples of selected wine, and a dessert thatâ€™s perfect for the season! Uncorked is offered on the Tuckasegee River Excursiondeparting on Feb 15 11AM. Looking for a memorable Valentines evening? Join us for a very special Uncorked on February 14 at 6PM - Sweetheart Valentine Evening Train! This 2 1/2 hour train ride follows the Tuckasegee River Excursion Route and features all the same unique experiences as our day time Uncorked. Tickets for both these experiences are $125 per person (Adults 21+ only). Due to the exclusivity of this specialty car, tickets will be selling fast so make sure to reserve your seat today! For Starters Enjoy a sampling of Havarti, muenster, & Gouda cheeses Soup Fresh Pumpkin Bisque Soup with Toasted Hazelnuts Served with a Warm Dinner Roll Main Course Onion Crusted Atlantic Baked Salmon topped with a Dijon Cream Sauce over a bed of Creamy Mushroom and Spinach. Tender Beef Slices topped with a Port Wine Reduction and Carrot SoufflÃ©. Dessert Vanilla Bean Cheesecake topped with fresh Raspberries #smokymountains #smokies #tnvacation #smokymountainsnationalpark #pigeonforgetn #greatsmokymountainsnationalpark #gsmnp #gatlinburg #tennesseetravel #pigeonforge #gatlinburgtennessee #gatlinburgtn #gatlinburgcabins #cabin2pines #twopinescabin #twopines #railroad #gsmr #greatsmokymountainrailroad #romanticdate #uniqueexperience

A post shared by Two Pines Cabins (@two_pines_smokymountains) on Feb 11, 2020 at 3:19am PST

The Great Smoky Mountains Railroad lets you explore the range through two equally scenic routes. You can either board the one that runs along rivers and over the Fontana lake into the gorge or search the historical route and wind through valleys and small towns.

posts.title: A Grand travel
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

The Grand Canyon railway - what a wonderful way to travel to the Grand Canyon ???????? Itâ€™s definitely a â€œgreatâ€ train journey with interesting scenery and on-board entertainment. Where else would you get fascinating information about local wildlife, ????????serenaded by cowboys ????and â€œrobbedâ€ by outlaws ..... (who fortunately were then arrested by the sheriff ????) whilst travelling to and from one of the worlds great natural wonders? We were lucky enough to have the company of good friends too - a truly memorable day â˜ºï¸ . . #transport_tuesday #grandcanyonrailway #grandcanyon #greattrainjourneys #efe_snapshots_travel #total_transport #trainstagram #railroad #pocket_rail #arizona #visitarizona #pocket_usa #usaphotolovers #just_unitedstates #insta_america #icu_usa #loves_united_states #total_americas #raw_usa #grandcanyonnationalpark #visit_arizona #excellent_universe #excellent_america #explore_earth_ #ig_greatshot #beautifuldestinations #ig_great_pics #worlds_beautiful_photos #my_daily_theme #mdt_0786

The Grand Canyon Railway offers the best view of the mystic Grand Canyon in under $100 and four hours. The train leaves from Flagstaff, Arizona, and travels north to the rim of the Canyon. Vintage steam-engine enthusiasts can hop on the train on Saturdays.

posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

We know our riders are missing scenic train rides like these. ???? While we continue to operate a limited schedule, we want to thank those using our service for essential travel for helping to keep fellow riders and employees safe by wearing a face covering while on board trains, buses, and at stations. #CCRiderRepost @coasterfan2105

A post shared by Capitol Corridor (@capitolcorridor) on May 14, 2020 at 9:19am PDT

The Capitol Corridor is a short journeyed train trip that gives you the best view. Running along the coastal city of San Jose, the train travels through the greenlands of Sacramento to the north and stops in San Francisco.

posts.title: A Northern delight
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

@amtrak traveling through Glacier National Park on time with next station being East Glacier in my second home of Montana #empirebuildertrain #railroad #railfanning

A post shared by Harrison Sadler (@amcr2004) on Feb 11, 2020 at 10:05pm PST

Being one of the longest train journeys in the country, the Empire Builder travels between Chicago and Seattle. The highlight of the trip is the 8-hour scenic stretch of Glacier National Park across the Green Plain and a seven-mile tunnel to the Cascade Mountains.

posts.title: Short but serene
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

"Metroliner Under the George Washington" Amtrak's Metroliner Conference Car, 9800, brings up the markers of Sunday's Amtrak 237 as the train traverses under the George Washington Bridge on the Empire Connection in New York City. 9800 is usually confined to the Northeast Corridor for use on specials and chartered trains, making this special car's trip on the Hudson Line extremely rare. #amtrak #empireconnection #amtrak9800 #metroliner #georgewashingtonbridge #gwb #empireservice #amtrakempireservice #amtrakmetroliner

A post shared by Gregory Grice (@the_gr0g) on Apr 6, 2020 at 9:06am PDT

If you donâ€™t have time on your hand, then the Empire Service is the train trip for you. It is a short train trip between NYC and Albany that rolls through some of the most beautiful landscapes along the Hudson River Valley.

posts.title: Tripping the Last Frontier
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Beautiful Alaska

A post shared by Julie, with an e (@julie.boselly) on Jul 23, 2016 at 11:45am PDT

The Alaska Coastal Classic takes you to one of the most scenic routes in the country. The trail winds through dramatic cliffs and mountain ranges that make up Alaskaâ€™s entire coastline before terminating at Seward.

posts.title: Serenity unlimited
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Chicago to NY with shoreline views: our #LakeShoreLimited train ????â›µ

A post shared by Amtrak (@amtrak) on Jul 31, 2019 at 8:00am PDT

Missing coastal train travel? The Lake Shore Limited is here to save the day. The train runs along the base of Lake Erie and Lake Michigan, passing the Mohawk River. Witness the beauty of the highlands of Berkshires and valleys of the wine country.

title: 15-minute Meals That Are Easy AND Delicious
desc:
Gone are the days when you could blame your schedule for skipping meals. From Buffalo wings to pasta, here are 15 dishes to quickly satisfy your hunger.
 
 
 
 With some intricate dishes demanding care and patience in equal measure, cooking against the clock can be a serious challenge. These time-consuming recipes are not for those who prefer quick and easy meals without too much hassle. Fortunately, some cracking, delicious foods can be easily prepared without violating the rules of the minute-hand. These meals are also fairly easy to cook and require minimal ingredients. Ready within 15 minutes tops, here are the 15 delicious dishes everyone should know of.

posts.title: Barbeque pork chops
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

????Recipe Time???? . Pork Chop Marsala???????????? . Served this with some Roasted Broccolini and Cauliflower Mash. (Trying to keep the carbs low this week! Quarantine Weight Gain is real ????????????) . Ingredients: 2-4 boneless pork chops 1 cup all purpose flour 1/4 cup olive oil (or Avocado) 8 oz porcini or bella mushrooms 1/2 cup marsala wine 1/2 cup chicken stock 1/4 cup heavy cream 1 tbs minced garlic 1 diced shallot 3 tbs butter 1 tbs chicken base salt, pepper, garlic, onion powder chopped parsley 1 tsp browning (optional for darker color, as needed) . Directions: Using a meat tenderizer, flatten the pork chops until they are even (about 1/4 inch thick) â€“ You can place them between some plastic wrap and flatten them. Season the chops with salt, pepper, garlic, onion powder. Add flour to mixing bowl and season with salt and pepper. Lightly coat the pork chops with flour and set aside while you get your pan hot. Heat oil in large skillet and add 2 tbs butter. Add pork chops and fry for 2-3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Remove the chops to a plate for later. Reduce heat to medium and add in mushrooms, shallots, and garlic. Season as you go. Cook this mixture for 3-4 minutes until the mushrooms are nicely browned. Pour in the marsala and increase heat to bring to a boil. Allow the alcohol to cook off a bit. Reduce heat to a simmer and add in chicken stock and cream. Add in remaining butter and mix together. Season as needed and add your chops back to the sauce. Baste with sauce and mushrooms and cover and cook until the pork chops hit 160 internal . Cooked in my @lodgecastiron skillet.. chicken base â€”> @betterthanbouillon -> chops @crowdcow (use code â€œmakeithappenâ€ for discount!) . #pork #porkchops #friedporkchops #smothered #chickenmarsala #dinnertime #easyrecipe #weeknightmeals #letseat #menthatcook #ichef #mrmakeithappen #foodies #foodlover #porkonyourfork #porkchop #recipeoftheday #cookingvideo #recipevideo #dinnerinspo #hungryaf

A post shared by Mr. Make It Happen (Matt) (@_mrmakeithappen_) on Apr 23, 2020 at 12:42pm PDT

The lively sauce makes for the perfect gravy, adding a burst of flavors to the chewy chops. Besides its incredible taste and superfast prep time, the dish looks quite attractive, as summed up by @_mrmakeithappen_.

posts.title: Spaghetti with shrimp
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Birthday girlâ€™s favorite dinner tonight - spaghetti with shrimp cooked in a light olive oil, garlic - lemon sauce that gets its richness from the starchy pasta water. While the pasta is cooking, sautÃ© on low heat minced garlic and green onions in olive oil. When they soften after a couple mins, add the shrimp and season with salt, black pepper and crushed red pepper. Toss the shrimp after 2 mins and then squeeze the juice from an entire lemon. Stir to combine. By this time spaghetti should be al dente. Save 2-3 large ladles of pasta water and drain. Transfer spaghetti to the pan with shrimp. Spoon the pasta water, 1 ladle at a time. Toss well to combine everything and cook for 2 mins. Take it off the heat and serve garnished with minced parsley and grated Parmesan on top! #signatureconcoctions #pasta #lemonsauce #15minutemeals

A post shared by ????????????????????????????| ???????????????????????????????????? ???????????????????????????????????????????? (@signatureconcoctions) on Jan 31, 2020 at 8:56pm PST

An ultimate time-saver and super tasty, shrimps are just perfect with creamy sauce. This dish by @signatureconcoctions looks light and is abundant with intense garlic flavors. Depending on your choice, the spaghetti can be replaced with rice or garlic bread.

posts.title: Creamy Tuscan garlic chicken
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Creamy Tuscan Chicken ???? TAG A FRIEND WHO WOULD LOVE THIS!! ???? - If you enjoy the content, please consider hitting the Follow button to support us! Stay Healthy peeps!????â£ ????@caloriesescape â£ ????@caloriesescape â£ ????@caloriesescape â£ - INGREDIENTS (for 4 servings) 4 bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs 2 teaspoons salt, for the chicken 1 teaspoon pepper, for the chicken 1 tablespoon oil 3 cloves garlic, chopped Â½ onion, diced 1 tomato, diced 2 cups spinach (80 g) 2 cups heavy cream (480 mL) 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon pepper Â½ cup grated parmesan cheese (55 g) 2 tablespoons fresh flat-leaf parsley, chopped . INSTRUCTIONS Season the chicken all over with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-low heat. Place the chicken thighs skin side down in the skillet and cook for about 13 minutes to crisp up the skin. Move the chicken around from time to time to ensure it cooks evenly. The skin should be hard to the touch. Flip the chicken, then cook for about another 15 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through. Remove from pan. Add the garlic and onion, stirring until onions are translucent. Stir in the tomatoes and spinach until the spinach is wilted. Add the heavy cream, salt, and pepper, bringing to a boil. Add the Parmesan cheese and parsley, stirring until the sauce has thickened slightly. Place the chicken back in the pan, spooning the sauce on top of the chicken. Enjoy! By: Alvin Zhou and Tasty #healthyfoodâ£ #healthyfoodadvice â£ #healthydinner #healthycooking #veggierecipes #veggies #eattherainbow #balancedmeal #healthyrecipes #breakfastbowl #lowcaloriemeals #healthybreakfast #healthydinners #healthylunch #healthyideas #quickmeals #healthydinnerideas #postworkoutmeal #mealprepping #homemademeals #nutritiousanddelicious
