posts.title: Ginger Noodle Soup
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Ginger noodle soup w/ cauliflower leaves ???? #nowaste â™» These are some of my all time fave ingredients PLUS the delicious and humble cauliflower leaf. Never to be thrown away again! I love to roast cauliflower leaves or stir fry them & like here, add them to broths and stews like you would cabbage. In the picture, Iâ€™ve used up my leftover roast chicken but if you love mushrooms, swap for mushrooms. This takes 15 minutes and is exactly what you want this week. More green soups coming up soon âœ”ï¸ Ginger noodle soup w/ cauliflower leaves Serves 2, takes 15 minutes 160g soba (buckwheat) noodles The leftover leaves from a cauliflower, roughly sliced vertically if ginormous or if the stems are very thick 1/2 tbsp coconut oil 2cm piece of ginger, finely chopped or finely grated 2 garlic cloves, finely chopped 1 bunch of spring onions, sliced 600ml quality veg or chicken broth or stock 2 handfuls of spinach or kale/cabbage, chopped 200g shiitake mushrooms, roughly sliced or 1 handful of leftover roast chicken Sea salt & pepper 2 tbsp tamari, to taste Chilli flakes/ chilli paste/ fresh chilli to taste Squeeze of lemon or lime METHOD 1. Gently fry the ginger and garlic with most of the spring onions in coconut oil for 5 minutes, stirring from time to time. (Save the rest of the spring onions for the end) 2. Meanwhile in a second pan, cook the noodles according to packet instructions & give them 30 seconds less than instructed then rinse them in cold water and set aside. 3. If youâ€™re using the mushrooms, add them to the first pan for a few minutes. Then add the stock/broth, pop the lid on and bring to the boil the immediately turn down to a medium simmer & add the cauliflower leaves. 4. If youâ€™re using kale, add them to the pan now too but if youâ€™re adding spinach, add it once the cauliflower leaves are tender after about 3-5 minutes. If youâ€™re adding leftover chicken, add with the cauliflower leaves so the chicken is heated all the way through. 5. Season with tamari, lemon juice & sea salt & pepper plus chilli if using. Add the noodles, taste for seasoning & serve straight away, topping with the last of the spring onions

A post shared by Melissa Hemsley ????feelgood food (@melissa.hemsley) on Jan 15, 2019 at 4:20am PST

Need to get rid of the spinach and kale stocked in your fridge? Add them to this super delicious and healthy ginger noodle soup. You can add quite a few veggies, just like @melissa.hemsley did.

title: 2020 is the Year You MUST Travel to These Places
desc: Travelers have always been in search of the most inspiring and exuberant places across the world. While some love luxurious trips, some do not mind backpacking and living in tents. Listed below are some of the best destinations that are worth a visit. Have a look at these gorgeous destinations that might soon become popular and add them to your bucket list!

posts.title: Rwanda
posts.content: Referred to as the land of a thousand hills, Rwanda is where the heart of nature lies. The country offers one of the best gorilla tourism packages and is ideal for those who want to witness authentic wildlife. Due to its rising popularity, Rwanda has now become a luxury safari destination.

posts.title: Jaisalmer, India
posts.content: If youâ€™re planning a holiday to India, donâ€™t forget to include Indiaâ€™s Golden City, Jaisalmer, to your itinerary. Located on the periphery of Thar Desert, the city is renowned for its yellow sandstone architecture and elegant hotels. Tourists primarily visit Jaisalmer to explore the Jaisalmer Fort, a massive sandstone castle.

posts.title: Nikko, Japan
posts.content: Are you planning to visit Japan for the 2020 Olympic Games? Since Tokyo will be crowded, you can escape to the nearby city of Nikko. The place has a glorious natural setting and is away from the hustle and bustle. Lake Chuzenji is one of the most popular spots among tourists and is located inside a national park that is one of UNESCOâ€™s World Heritage sites.

posts.title: Finger Lakes, New York
posts.content: The Finger Lakes area in New York is fantastic if youâ€™re planning a family vacation or a weekend getaway with friends. The area comprises 11 lakes located in gorgeous settings and some of them even feature gushing waterfalls. Named after its 11 digit-shaped lakes, the Finger Lakes region is renowned for its exceptional wines, especially Riesling wines.

posts.title: Wyoming
posts.content: Ever thought of traveling to the least-populated state in the US? If yes, youâ€™ll be delighted to know that it is home to some of the most thrilling places: the incredible Yellowstone National Park, the mighty Grand Teton mountain, and the picturesque Jackson Hole.

posts.title: Sri Lanka
posts.content: Sri Lanka is probably the best tropical country to visit if you have a restricted budget. The pleasant warm climate, sandy beaches, and delicious food are some of the reasons to include Sri Lanka to your bucket list. You can also explore a few ancient Buddhist temples and hike through the verdant hills dotted with tea plantations.

posts.title: Ethiopia
posts.content: With a robust cultural history combined with picturesque landscapes and joyful festivals, Ethiopia is a prominent destination among avid travelers. Along with Lalibelaâ€™s 800-year-old monolithic churches, travelers can witness the distinguished tribes of Omo River, and wildlife on one of Africaâ€™s highest mountains.

posts.title: Chilean Lake District
posts.content: The Chilean Lake District is one of Chileâ€™s most picturesque regions, featuring dramatic landscapes and serene lakeside villages. The district also adorns some beautiful national parks and snow-capped volcanoes. However, it is advised to plan your visit in December 2020, as this place is anticipated to be even more mesmerizing during the total solar eclipse phenomena.

posts.title: Galway, Ireland
posts.content: Galway holds the title of the European Capital of Culture for 2020. Isnâ€™t that a good enough reason to visit the city? With several independent businesses and a lively nightlife, Galway flaunts itself as a city where people live freely.

posts.title: Jamaica
posts.content: Jamaica is one of the most popular vacation spots because of the pleasant tropical weather, pristine beaches, and exotic seafood. The country has a lively music scene as it is the birthplace of Bob Marley and reggae. You can even learn about the Rastafari culture and philosophy while in the country or try recreational activities like scuba diving in the clear turquoise waters.

posts.title: SÃ£o TomÃ© and PrÃ­ncipe
posts.content: Located in the Gulf of Guinea, the island nation of SÃ£o TomÃ© and PrÃ­ncipe has thriving jungles and volcanic peaks. Thereâ€™s also a plethora of wild animals and birds to spot across the island, making it a top choice among nature lovers and adventurers.

posts.title: St. Petersburg, Russia
posts.content: You must visit St. Petersburg at least once in your lifetime to experience White Nights of St. Petersburg. Since the city is located near the Arctic Circle, it barely sees any darkness in the warmer months. Itâ€™s worth a visit if you want to appreciate this rare phenomenon.

posts.title: The Dead Sea
posts.content: Can you imagine what it feels like to relax and float effortlessly on water? The only way to experience this magic is by planning a visit to the Dead Sea, the lowest water body on earth. Located between Israel and Jordan, itâ€™s a must-visit place if youâ€™re touring the Middle East.

posts.title: Dominica
posts.content: With dense rainforests, green mountain peaks, and gorges crisscrossed by hundreds of rivers, Dominica is a place to behold for all. Itâ€™s a little 29-mile long Caribbean country that is full of embracing people and nature-filled adventures, such as trekking, rappelling, scuba diving, and canyoning.

posts.title: Vancouver Island, British Columbia
posts.content: Do you love watching whales in your leisure time? Vancouver Island is one of the top whale-watching spots in the world with a 95% chance of spotting orcas or killer whales. This large island, located off the west coast of North America, is home to immaculate beaches and rich forests. The island is easily accessible via daily ferries from British Columbia and Washington.

posts.title: Marquesas Islands
posts.content: If youâ€™re an adventurer and wish to get out of your comfort zone, then travel to this faraway island, the Marquesas Islands. Itâ€™s a volcanic archipelago located in the South Pacific Ocean. The island will be soon traversed by renowned explorer and documentarian Sven-Olof Lindblad in April 2020, attracting visitors across the world.

posts.title: Israel
posts.content: Israel is a classic destination fit for all kinds of travelers. The country often bewilders people with the contrasting culture of its two most famous cities, Tel Aviv and Jerusalem. While Jerusalem is the holiest city in the world, Tel Aviv is one of the coolest cities in the Mediterranean with glamorous nightlife, beaches, and exquisite food.

posts.title: Egypt
posts.content: Egypt is one of those rare countries that has yet preserved its rich history and unique culture until today. Moreover, the countryâ€™s clear blue beaches with golden sands are ideal for couples, friends, families, and even solo travelers.

posts.title: Slovenia
posts.content: Slovenia, a small country in the Alps, has something for everyone. The country is gradually becoming a leading weekend destination for neighboring European countries because of its beautiful setting, delicious food, and adventure sports, like kayaking, zip-lining, and bungee jumping.

posts.title: Dubai, United Arab Emirates
posts.content: If you want to know what glamorous looks like, plan a vacation to the UAE. With one of the most advanced cities in the world, Dubai is home to the tallest building in the world, the Burj Khalifa. You can also visit the UAE to attend Expo 2020, the first World Expo to be held in the Middle East.

posts.title: Lille, France
posts.content: Crowned the 2020 World Capital of Design, Lille is one of the most delightful cities in France. The city will captivate you with its fabulous French and Flemish architecture, chic shopping markets, and delicious cuisine. Art lovers, especially, have a lot to experience in the city, such as world-class museums, quaint art galleries, and fascinating exhibitions.

posts.title: Copenhagen, Denmark
posts.content: Copenhagen is often referred to as the happy capital of one of the happiest countries in the world. The city has always been attracting travelers because of its relaxed cycling culture, colorful merchant house, and unique restaurants.

posts.title: Zambia
posts.content: A trip to Zambia will take you out of your comfort zone and closer to nature. With 30% of its land reserved for national parks, the country features some of the most breathtaking views and diverse wildlife for adventurers to see.

posts.title: Bangkok, Thailand
posts.content: Bangkok, Thailandâ€™s burgeoning city, has been ranked as the worldâ€™s most visited city for four years in a row. The city is known for its exotic cuisine, enchanting temples, lively nightlife, and, of course, the floating markets.

posts.title: Honolulu, Hawaii
posts.content: Honolulu might just be the right spot for your next laid-back vacation. You can sunbathe in the white sandy beaches and go hiking over the island with sweeping views. You can also plan a visit to the historic Pearl Harbour Memorial or take some time out to try fun adventure sports, like parasailing, scuba diving, or kayaking.

posts.title: Brazil
posts.content: With more than 2,000 beaches, Brazil is another fantastic destination for a laid-back vacation. While in the country, you can explore the famous Amazon Rainforest and even witness the jaw-dropping IguaÃ§u Falls. Moreover, the countryâ€™s capital Rio De Janeiro is widely popular for its overnight Carnival festival characterized by flashy costumes and the traditional samba dance.

posts.title: Montenegro
posts.content: This little Balkan country is a pleasant combination of medieval villages, aristocratic mansions, and beaches. While traveling across Montenegro, you will be greeted by tall, verdant mountains. Also, if you want to savor some of the finest cuisines in the Mediterranean, Montenegro is the place to go.

posts.title: Northern Guatemala
posts.content: From Lake AtitlÃ¡n to the Mayan ruins of Tikal, Guatemala has a diverse culture to experience. Recently, National Geographic stated that the latest technology is being employed to discover the ancient Mayan ruins and artifacts concealed under the jungle canopy. History enthusiasts, are you listening?

posts.title: New Zealand
posts.content: This gorgeous country island is one of the top destinations among adventurists and backpackers. Although Auckland, Christchurch, and Wellington are popular, you should visit Okarito Beach to watch the marvelous sunset below the snowy peaks of the Southern Alps. Itâ€™s also easy to travel to New Zealand and the reward is much more than sublime landscapes across the country.

title: 2020â€™s Cinema Docket - Films Your Watchlist is Incomplete Without
desc: 2019 was a big year for films. 2020, however, seems to be even more promising with the number of terrific movies on the horizon. From Christopher Nolanâ€™s most secretive project to fantasy epics like Godzilla vs. Kong, we got the rundown of the 30 best movies that shouldnâ€™t be missed. Letâ€™s have a look.

posts.title: The Invisible Man (February 28)
posts.content: The Mummy starring Tom Cruise bombed at the box office; this led Universal Pictures to abandon their Dark Universe franchise, including The Invisible Man starring Johnny Depp. Later, Leigh Whannell (best known for the Insidious series) was hired to reinvent this HG Wellsâ€™s classic. The film stars Elisabeth Moss as Cecilia Kass, who is menaced by an abusive ex.

posts.title: Spenser Confidential (March 6)
posts.content: After working together on films like Deepwater Horizon, Patriots Day, and Lone Survivor, Mark Wahlberg and director Peter Berg are back with this Netflix Original, marking their fifth collaboration. The film will also star Winston Duke, Alan Arkin, Iliza Shlesinger, and Post Malone.

posts.title: First Cow (March 6)
posts.content: Based on Jonathan Raymondâ€™s novel The Half-Life: A Novel, First Cow is one of the frontrunners for the Golden Bear at the 70th Berlin International Film Festival. Kelly Reichardtâ€™s film tells the story of the friendship between Cookie (played by John Magaro) and Chinese immigrant King-Lu (played Orion Lee), as they join hands to make money by stealing milk from a rich English landlordâ€™s cow.

posts.title: A Quiet Place: Part II (March 20)
posts.content: John Krasinskiâ€™s Quiet Place was a surprising addition to our favorite horror-thriller list back in 2018. This year, Krasinskiâ€™s back with the sequel A Quiet Place: Part II where a gloomy stranger joins the family in the fight against terrifying extraterrestrial creatures. With Krasinski in the directorâ€™s seat again, this dystopian film retains its original cast including Emily Blunt, Millicent Simmonds, and Noah Jupe along with some new faces.

posts.title: Mulan (March 27)
posts.content: Like Aladdin in 2019, Disney is all set to bring us the live-action version of the beloved warrior princess Mulan. The new one, of course, has some distinctive changes. Firstly, it is an epic war film and not a musical as one would expect. Secondly, it wouldnâ€™t feature the goofy dragon, Mushu. But then the trailer looks so rad, we hope it pays off!

posts.title: The New Mutants (April 3)
posts.content: After being delayed for nearly two years, this X-Men reboot is all set for its release in the first week of April. Itâ€™s finally going to make its way to audiences but via Disney+. The New Mutants follows the story of five teen mutants who are trying to escape a research facility. Directed by Josh Boone, this spinoff stars Maisie Williams, Charlie Heaton, and Anya Taylor-Joy.

posts.title: No Time To Die (April 10)
posts.content: After five years, at last, Daniel Craigâ€™s James Bond is here to bless us with his presence after five freaking years. It is all the more amusing because Craig publicly claimed heâ€™d â€œrather slash his wristsâ€ than do it again. Yikes! We donâ€™t care what changed his mind, Agent 007 is here for the last hurrah and we are all over it. The final film is directed by Cary Fukunaga of True Detective and features Oscar-winner Rami Malek as the big baddie.

posts.title: Promising Young Woman (April 17)
posts.content: â€œTake her home and take your chances,â€ an intriguing tagline for an equally intriguing plot. Promising Young Woman stars Carey Mulligan as Cassie, a young woman who takes retribution one step ahead. Directed by Emerald Fennell, who also penned the sophomore season of Killing Eve, the movie has already garnered a terrific response at the Sundance Film Festival, heightening our excitement.

posts.title: Antebellum (April 24)
posts.content: With strong performances in movies such as Moonlight, Hidden Figures, and Harriet, Janelle MonÃ¡e will now be seen in a leading role in Antebellum. The actress will play Veronica, a writer who gets stuck between present-day reality and pre-American Civil War. Like Get Out, the makers are keeping most plot details under wraps, which is great as we would like to be surprised.

posts.title: Black Widow (May 1)
posts.content: The Avengers franchise might have come to an end, but Scarlett Johansson is back in action with the much-awaited standalone feature, Black Widow. After delivering an emotionally taxing performance in Marriage Story, we are eager to see her in a badass avatar. The movie follows the events of Captain America: Civil War where the former KGB assassin is compelled to confront a treacherous conspiracy related to her past. The film will be directed by Cate Shortland and will also star Oscar-nominated actress Florence Pugh.

posts.title: The Personal History of David Copperfield (May 8)
posts.content: After playing at major cinema festivals last year, Armando Iannucciâ€™s refreshing adaptation of Dickens's classic comedy will finally hit the theatres this May. In this reimagined version, Dev Patel plays the titular character with Tilda Swinton as Aunt Betsey Trotwood and Hugh Laurie as Mr. Dick. On casting Dev Patel instead of a Caucasian actor, Iannucci said, â€œI want the audience to feel that this is a fresh story and a new story, rather than us telling something thatâ€™s been told for centuries.â€

posts.title: Fast and the Furious 9 (May 22)
posts.content: Director Justin Lin has returned to work his magic alongside new cast members, including John Cena and Cardi B. Reportedly, Lin will be directing the tenth installment thatâ€™s yet to be titled and will be released in 2021. Also, we will see a posthumous appearance of Paul Walker.

posts.title: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge on the Run (May 22)
posts.content: SpongeBob renews his cinematic journey in The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge on the Run. SpongeBob and Patrick go on a mission to free Gary from his captors through the Lost City of Atlantis. Whatâ€™s more exciting is that Keanu Reeves will be making a cameo. Twitteratis have already gone nuts over this development and are calling this Reeves's best performance so far.

posts.title: Wonder Woman 1984 (June 5)
posts.content: Our favorite â€œGalâ€ is back with the most anticipated superhero flick of the year, Wonder Woman 1984. Like the previous installment, this feature is directed by Patty Jenkins and is expected to make it rain at the box office. The warrior princess will be seen battling Cheetah (played by Kristen Wiig) and Max (played by Pedro Pascal).

posts.title: Candyman (June 12)
posts.content: Hollywoodâ€™s penchant for horror remakes isnâ€™t new, and this year we are blessed with the reboot of the iconic 1992 Candyman. The directorial rein for this fresh version is handed to Nia da Costa (known for Little Woods). Also, Tony Todd is onboard to play the titular antagonist. Weâ€™ll see Yahya Abdul-Mateen II and Teyonah Parris in the feature, too. However, we are yet to know details about the new plot thatâ€™s co-written by Academy Award recipient Jordan Peele.

posts.title: Soul (June 19)
posts.content: Soul is directed by Pete Docter whoâ€™s also known for Inside Out, Up, and Monsters Inc. Starring Jamie Foxx, this animated feature follows the story of a middle school music teacher Joe Gardener whoâ€™s soul gets separated from his body. Besides Foxx, the film also stars Tina Fey and Questlove.

posts.title: Top Gun: Maverick (June 26)
posts.content: The long-awaited sequel to Top Gun, this action drama brings back Tom Cruise as Captain Pete "Maverick" Mitchell indulging in some insane jet piloting and deadly stunts. Apart from Cruise, the cast includes Val Kilmer, Jennifer Connelly, Jon Hamm, Ed Harris, and Miles Teller.

posts.title: In the Heights (June 26)
posts.content: Jon M. Chu who is known for Crazy Rich Asians is all set to bring us In the Heights, which is based on a Broadway musical drama. Getting Chu onboard makes complete sense as he has previously directed several installments of the Step Up franchise. The film will star Anthony Ramos as Usnavi de la Vega. Moreover, Corey Hawkins, Leslie Grace, Stephanie Beatrice, Jimmy Smits, and Marc Anthony are also a part of the cast.

posts.title: Tenet (July 17)
posts.content: Christopher Nolan is back with his most ambitious project to date, Tenet. What do we know about the movie? Sadly, not much. The action thrillerâ€™s trailer doesnâ€™t give away a lot, besides the fact that it may include time travel and a whole lot of intrigue. Along with John David Washington in the lead role, we will also see Robert Pattinson finally making a comeback to commercial cinema.

posts.title: Morbius (July 31)
posts.content: Letâ€™s face it, Jared Letoâ€™s run as Joker was questionable. This year, weâ€™ll be seeing him as Dr. Michael Morbius who is afflicted by a rare blood disease. In an attempt to cure himself, he tries a risky solution that causes him to have vampire-like powers. Intriguing, right? We canâ€™t wait to see how Jared brings this tormented anti-hero to life on the silver screen.

posts.title: The Many Saints of Newark (September 25)
posts.content: Prequel to the legendary HBO series The Sopranos, The Many Saints of Newark is also written by David Chase. The movie takes us through the life of Dickie Moltisanti (Alessandro Nivola) and Johnny Boy Soprano (Jon Bernthal) and their rise in the New Jersey mob in the 1960s, a time when racial tensions were amplified. This reboot will star Vera Farmiga, Corey Stoll, Ray Liotta, John Magaro, and Corey Stall.

posts.title: The King's Man (September 18)
posts.content: The Kingsman franchise has spawned a prequel with the legendary Ralph Fiennes as the Duke of Oxford who kicks off an iconic spy agency in the 1900s to take down Rasputin. This movie features an ensemble including Harris Dickinson, Gemma Arterton, Rhys Ifans, Stanley Tucci, and Djimon Hounsou.

posts.title: Last Night In Soho (September 25)
posts.content: Three years after the massive success of Baby Driver, Edgar Wright is back with his latest flick Last Night in Soho, a psychological horror set in 1960s London. Wrightâ€™s film is said to be inspired by Nicolas Roegâ€™s Donâ€™t Look Now and Roman Polanskiâ€™s Repulsion. The movie stars Thomas McKenzie, Anya Taylor-Joy, Matt Smith, and Diana Rigg in pivotal roles.

posts.title: The Witches (October 9)
posts.content: The 1990s movie adaptation of Roald Dahlâ€™s classic scarred the childhoods of many, especially during the scene where the beautiful Anjelica Huston reveals her nasty avatar. Spine-chilling even today! Now, thirty years later, Robert Zemeckis is back with a new adaptation with Anne Hathaway as the Grand High Witch which we have high hopes from. The reboot also stars Octavia Spencer, Stanley Tucci, and Chris Rock.

posts.title: Stillwater (November 6)
posts.content: After directing the Oscar-winning Spotlight, Tom McCarthy is making a comeback with Stillwater. His new project features Matt Damon as Bill Baker, an oil-rig roughneck, who is struggling to exonerate his estranged daughter (played by Abigail Breslin) of a murder she didnâ€™t commit. Sounds like a tear-jerker.

posts.title: The Eternals (November 6)
posts.content: If you canâ€™t get over the Avengers franchise, then you have The Eternals, another superhero saga to look forward to. With the cast including big names such as Angelina Jolie, Salma Hayek, Kit Harrington, Kumail Nanjiani, and Gemma Chan, this brand-new addition to the Marvel cinematic universe brings us the story of ancient aliens who have to step out of secrecy after living on Earth covertly for the past 7,000 years to fight mankindâ€™s oldest enemies.

posts.title: Godzilla Vs. Kong (November 20)
posts.content: Directed by Adam Wingard, this marks the first remake of the 1962 Japanese film <i>King Kong vs. Godzilla<i />. We are beyond excited to watch these goliaths fight it out on the silver screen, and weâ€™re not sure who we are rooting for. Apart from the crazy special effects, the film has a wonderful star cast including Alexander SkarsgÃ¥rd, Millie Bobby Brown, Kyle Chandler, and Brian Tyree Henry.

posts.title: Dune (December 18)
posts.content: David Lynchâ€™s version was not the best attempt as the movie couldnâ€™t accommodate the bookâ€™s dense plot. However, the latest version by Dennis Villeneuve will be a two-part adaptation. Despite being impressed by Lynchâ€™s feature, Villeneuve clarified, â€œâ€¦it was not what I had dreamed of, so Iâ€™m trying to make the adaptation of my dreams. It will not have any link with the David Lynch movie. Iâ€™m going back to the book, and going to the images that came out when I read it.â€ Moreover, Warner Bros has put together a splendid ensemble including TimothÃ©e Chalamet, Oscar Isaac, Stellan SkarsgÃ¥rd, Zendaya, Jason Momoa, Josh Brolin, and Rebecca Ferguson.

posts.title: West Side Story (December 18)
posts.content: Steven Spielberg directing a musical is this yearâ€™s early Christmas gift to everyone. With his third collaboration with screenwriter Tony Kushner, West Side Story stars Ansel Elgort and newcomer Rachel Zegler as star-crossed lovers, Tony and Maria. This adaptation of the celebrated Broadway musical will also star Ariana DeBose, David Alvarez, Corey Stall, and Rita Moreno.

posts.title: News of the World (December 25)
posts.content: Weâ€™ll also see more of Tom Hanks this year with movies like Bios, Greyhound, and News of the World. For this project, Hanks will be reuniting with director Paul Greengrass. Based on the novel by Paulette Jiles, we will see Hanks portray a Civil War captain who is hired to rescue an abducted young girl.

title: 22 Ways to Get Out of This Quarantine With Your Sanity and Relationship Intact
desc:
Being cooped up indoors can be testing if youâ€™re not used to it, especially with a whole other person added to this mix. They tell you absence makes the heart grow fonder but nobody tells you what happens if your partner is a room away at all times with the TV playing loudly. Throw in a tense environment too and bam! Youâ€™ve got a recipe for disaster. Thereâ€™s no denying that things can be difficult, but do they have to be this way? Not if it can be helped! 
 
 Here are 22 ways you can ensure you, your SO, and the relationship survives this quarantine.

posts.title: Help each other to deal with this situation
posts.content: The world is still reeling from the news of this pandemic. Some are coming to terms with the loss of their loved ones while others are grappling with the scarcity of resources. Help ground one another to the present as you deal with strong emotions.

posts.title: Be present
posts.content: During this quarantine, it helps to be physically present and supportive for your SO. Carve out sometime in a day to be there in each otherâ€™s presence and focus on what can be done to make your partner feel better.

posts.title: Do not be emotionally withdrawn
posts.content: People have different ways of coping, but if your partner is sharing their emotions with you, choosing to be standoffish and emotionally withdrawn can worsen things for the both of you immediately.

posts.title: Kindness and respect go a long way
posts.content: Try not to roll your eyes, show contempt, or even belittle your partner as they go about their day. Being disrespectful closes the doors to communication and opens the doors to troubles in your relationship.

posts.title: Make a conflict-resolution strategy
posts.content: There are going to be disagreements and fights, but it would be remiss of you if you let that come in the way of your relationship. How do you tackle this? Work together and think the issue through before saying something you will regret.

posts.title: Use this time to get closer
posts.content: Hopefully, weâ€™re never going to be in a situation like this ever again. Even if youâ€™re not stuck at home together out of your free will, use this time to get in some quality bonding. Discuss a novel, talk about politics, whatever floats your boat!

posts.title: But also respect boundaries
posts.content: If your partner is being obsessive about things like cleaning, donâ€™t chide them for being an overkill. Everyone is anxious about the current situation and this may help them feel in control. Help out and remind yourself that love is the way.

posts.title: Ensure your partner is aware of your needs
posts.content: If something about your partner is bugging you, communicate it, and also mention how they can fix it. Donâ€™t mope about, brood, and expect them to read your mind. Communication is key to the survival of your relationship.

posts.title: Donâ€™t forget to split up those chores and burdens
posts.content: Staying indoors always means twice the amount of cooking, dishes, and laundry needs to be done. Aside from dividing the chores evenly, lend an ear to gripes about how things are tough and the new laundry powder is just not good enough.

posts.title: And then be a responsible partner
posts.content: Now that youâ€™ve divided the responsibilities, ensure that you actually get it done. Do not leave the majority of the work for your partner, as that is majorly uncool and will lead to tensions and fights.

posts.title: Avoid being condescending, itâ€™s not helping anyone
posts.content: If your SO has certain preferences that do not match yours, or certain worries you cannot relate to, there is no need to be all high and mighty. Itâ€™s just plain rude to dismiss someoneâ€™s choices, especially since youâ€™re one of them!

posts.title: Stay away from the criticism train
posts.content: Even if it feels like the world would be better if you ran it, abstain from constantly criticizing everything. It will add to the list of things to worry about and wonâ€™t help anyone in the long run. Try to maintain a positive atmosphere.

posts.title: Take breaks when necessary
posts.content: Everyone needs some space and downtime eventually. Hence, being stuck at home for a prolonged period will make you get on each otherâ€™s nerves. Just move into the next room for a bit and you will soon be refreshed for another cuddle sesh.

posts.title: Try a new routine
posts.content: Being in quarantine is an eye-opener. What previously seemed like a monotonous routine is now a blessing you didnâ€™t appreciate enough. If staying indoors is making you a slouch, then find a new normal thatâ€™ll keep you stimulated.

posts.title: Get some â€œalone togetherâ€ time to ignite the flame
posts.content: Between working and struggling to maintain a semblance of social life, couples tend to have less time with each other. So, if itâ€™s been a while since youâ€™ve shared some intimate moments, you have all the time in the world now.

posts.title: Go on dates
posts.content: Just because you cannot leave your home does not mean you cannot have a date! Set up a romantic candlelight dinner with soft music and feed your boo some mac and cheese.

posts.title: Check-in on your partner
posts.content: To try to maintain a sense of normalcy, check in on your SO throughout the day just as you would if the two of you were at work. It always feels nice to know someone is looking out for you.

posts.title: Get in those couple workouts
posts.content: Keeping your mind and body healthy should be your number one priority in these tough times. So, without wasting any more time, plan a workout schedule and ensure that the two of you stick to it. Nothing like having a workout partner!

posts.title: Make some future plans
posts.content: Being shut in together is a great time to discuss the future. Do you both want to plan for kids? Adopt a pet? Where do youâ€™ll see yourselves individually and together in five years?

posts.title: Pick up a new two-people hobby
posts.content: Gardening, 8000-piece puzzles, unsolved crimes, ridiculous games that you would never opt to play â€” everything is now an option. You can also seriously consider picking up a new skill or shared activity such as baking.

posts.title: Have those deep meaningful conversations
posts.content: Drowning amidst all the deadlines means youâ€™ve probably been short on time to actually talk to your partner. Instead of a few short sentences every night, have a conversation youâ€™ve been meaning to or just sit and reminisce for hours together.

posts.title: Play board games but with a twist
posts.content: Thereâ€™s only so much Netflix one can binge. Pull the plug on that plan, literally, and get out those old dusty board games and get to playing. Try spicing things up by adding a challenge to it!

title: 25 Fitness Challenges to Follow While You're at Home
desc:
If youâ€™re at home by choice or because you have no other choice, one of the best things you can do is try to stay fit. No, weâ€™re not asking you to register for a tedious course online. Instead, try something trending and inspiring, like a yoga or plank challenge. These will help you stay fit and keep you occupied so that boredom doesnâ€™t stand a chance. Moreover, you challenge your loved ones on social media to keep them occupied.
 
 Practicing yoga and exercising regularly makes your immune system robust, which is great to help you stay strong, keeping all ailments at bay. So, go through the list below and try some of these amazing challenges to make your time at home interesting.

posts.title: Yoga for Beginners At Home 30 Day Challenge - Fightmaster Yoga
posts.content: If youâ€™ve never tried yoga, this 30-day program by Lesley Fightmaster could be your perfect chance to enter the yoga world. Lesley understands how yoga can be intimidating for a beginner and ensures participants are comfortable with yoga poses in no time. From body alignment and breathing to fun transitions, this yoga challenge makes you adept at yoga in 30 days.

posts.title: 30 Days of Yoga - Yoga With Adriene
posts.content: Adriene is one of the most famous online yoga teachers. Her expertise in yoga is unbeatable, and her fun teaching methods help you learn new yoga asanas every time you watch her videos. Her 30-day program is great for everyone and goes beyond the physical nature of life, bringing in subtle aspects like meditation, awareness, and activation of chakras.

posts.title: 1000 Cardio & Core Burn Challenge - Joanna Soh
posts.content: A cardio challenge that involves no running? The best thing ever! But donâ€™t underestimate this challenge, as it will have you drenched in sweat from head to toe. Itâ€™s a four-week challenge for 3 days per week curated by fitness personality Joanna Soh. The challenge is to hit 1,000 cardio and core burn workout reps in the final week. From jumping jacks to push-ups, the challenge involves back to back 10 powerful exercises.

posts.title: 12-Day Restorative Yoga Holiday Challenge - Yoga International
posts.content: Has years of non-stop work made you stressful and less exuberant about life? Consider your stay at home a brief holiday and utilize it to give your body and mind some time for relaxation. The experts from Yoga International have designed 12 days of short, calming, and revitalizing practices that will help you relieve stress and recharge your body and brain with more energy.

posts.title: 7 Days Chakra Challenge - Brett Larkin Yoga
posts.content: If youâ€™re looking to delve deep into the practice of yoga and understand some fundamentals of lifeâ€™s energies, then you must take this 7-day chakra challenge. The challenge will focus on each of the seven chakras for seven days. As a bonus, you will also learn what the chakras are and how to meditate on every single one of them.

posts.title: 7 Days Of Yin Yoga - Ekhart Yoga
posts.content: Yin yoga teaches you to balance the counter yang energy that we build up throughout our hectic lives with the typical practice of yoga. There are several 7-day yin yoga programs offered by different teachers that condition you to sit longer while practicing yoga. However, this particular 7-day challenge by Ekhart focuses on something different each day, such as hips, spine, legs, upper body, chakras, breath, and mind.

posts.title: 21 Day Challenge - Yoga Journal
posts.content: Yoga journal is one of the most authentic and comprehensive sources for expert information on yoga and health. You can be assured that this 21-day challenge will be truly refreshing for your mind and body. The program is suitable for all levels of yogis and starts with setting the intention of your practice. Additionally, you will also learn recipes to fuel up your practice.

posts.title: 30 Day Cardio Challenge - My Protein
posts.content: Yes, you can do a cardio challenge at home! We know that when it comes to pumping your heart rate, nothing comes close to an intense cardio workout. This 30-day cardio challenge has you do an average of 20 reps of different exercises every day. Throughout the challenge, you'll be performing powerful exercises, like mountain climbers, burpees, power squats, basketball jumps, and other heart-pumping drills.

posts.title: 1 Minute 30-Day Yoga Challenge - Darebee
posts.content: This 1-minute yoga challenge is ideal for those who work from home and donâ€™t have time to commit even 10 minutes daily. This 30-day challenge is seemingly simple: hold a pose for 60 seconds. While it may feel easy in the beginning, expect it to get challenging as each day progresses. You will notice a huge difference in your understanding of yoga by the end of this challenge.

posts.title: The 200 Squats Challenge - Vicky Justiz
posts.content: If youâ€™re looking to gain some serious glute muscles, take this 200 squats challenge by the fitness expert Vicky Justiz. And since youâ€™re locked at home anyway, you donâ€™t need to worry much about the post squat soreness. This challenge will make your thighs burn and put your leg strength to the ultimate test. Do this challenge once a week to get the body you desire.

posts.title: 30-Day Self-Love Yoga Challenge - Refinery29
posts.content: This self-love yoga challenge aims to make you aware of your thoughts and emotions and explains self-love. Each day, the challenge starts with a beautiful meditation and concludes with a calming restorative yoga pose, like legs up the wall. Along with boosting your immune system, these asanas help you understand the real meaning of self-love.

posts.title: 30 Days of Mindful Movement - Alo Yoga
posts.content: Alo Yoga brings a transformative 30-day yoga challenge with some of the greatest teachers in the world. These yoga masters will take you through a daily program that zeroes in on resolutions, energy, mindfulness, and strength to help you. Alo is also a famous yoga clothing brand and their yoga family comprises some of the most influential yogis in the world. So, you can expect the program to be effective.

posts.title: 30-Day Burpee Challenge with Jen Widerstrom - FITNESS Magazine
posts.content: Everybody loves to hate burpees. Itâ€™s one move that leaves you out of breath, but we secretly know that burpees are exactly what our bodies need. In this challenge, you will be given a burpee variation every day of the week. Expect in the following weeks, the variations get more intense and the numbers are bumped up. So, are you ready to take this extreme fitness test?

posts.title: 30/30 Yoga Challenge - Ekhart Yoga
posts.content: Now that isolation has bought you enough time, are you ready to commit 30 minutes each day for 30 days? This is a progressive program that leads you from basics to advanced exercises, and focuses on the core, balances poses, and integrates the two in between. If youâ€™re a beginner or intermediate level yogi who is looking to up your skills, this challenge has a lot to offer.

posts.title: The 14-Day Yoga Shred Challenge - DoYouYoga
posts.content: If 30 days is too much of a commitment for you, switch to this 14-day challenge. These 10-minute challenges involve several high-intensity yoga and fitness exercises that focus on burning calories and reducing belly fat. Mind you, the flow here can be a bit tricky and fast-paced to keep your heart rate pumped up throughout the session.

posts.title: 14-day Coupleâ€™s Yoga Challenge - Ryan and Alex
posts.content: If youâ€™re confined with your partner at home, itâ€™s a great time to take your relationship to another level now that you both have time together. Guided by the husband-wife duo Ryan and Alex, doing this yoga challenge builds deep connection, openness, patience, and trust between couples. Couples, get ready to devote 30 minutes each day for 14 days to help your relationship.

posts.title: The Original Yoga Challenge - Bad Yogi Yoga
posts.content: You might have already seen some videos by Bad Yogi on YouTube. But itâ€™s time for you to participate in the challenge for 30 days straight. With 10-20 minutes of exercises each day, you will improve your flexibility, strength, balance. Moreover, you will enjoy learning yoga with yoga master Erin Motz. The challenge is appropriate for all, newbies and seasoned experts.

posts.title: The FBI Fitness Challenge
posts.content: This FBI challenge recreated by BuzzFeedâ€™s YouTube channel is incredibly insane and puts your fitness skills to the ultimate test. From long-distance running and non-stop push-ups to multiple sets of the sit-ups, your body will be pushed to the utmost level. If you're breathing like a normal human being after completing this challenge, you are extraordinary. Well, consider joining the FBI perhaps.

posts.title: The 30 days of Yoga Challenge with Jessica Rose - DoYouYoga
posts.content: Seems like 30-day challenges are the go-to choice for most yoga teachers. Another yogi Jessica Rose takes you on a 30-day journey of guided feel-good movements that will spark your yoga practice. Her exercises help you understand your body and appreciate it. Her videos are only 10-20 minutes long and will make you feel stronger, more flexible, and relaxed.

posts.title: 30-Day Plank Challenge - Kayla Itsines
posts.content: Plank challenges will never get old! If you hate doing crunches, Planks are your best alternative to help build your core. Planks and its variations put pressure on your abs, obliques, and back to effectively tighten your torso. In this challenge, Instagram fitness star Kayla Itsines encourages you to do a variety of plank positions for less than 10 minutes. Moreover, the intensity of your workout increases every five days. The program is divided into levels to make it easier for all.

posts.title: Yoga Fix 90 - Fightmaster Yoga
posts.content: This challenge is surely not for all! While 30-day challenges are great to begin with, 90-day challenges have the true potential of transforming your life. Research says that it takes about 66 days to form a deep-rooted habit, and Lesley is strongly driven by this. During this program with her, youâ€™ll focus on all main muscles and perform high-intensity interval training (HIIT) and a relaxing restorative practice weekly.

posts.title: Beginner Yoga Challenge - Yoga Lifestyles
posts.content: This classic yoga pose challenge was launched back in 2016, and itâ€™s time we bring it back. The entire 30-day yoga challenge comprises 30 different poses, right from a simple mountain pose to the challenging hip-opening split for anyone to jump into. Execute the pose perfectly each day, click a picture, post it on social media, and of course, challenge your friends.

posts.title: Men's 30 Day Yoga Challenge - Do You Yoga
posts.content: Guys, you donâ€™t always need to go out, hit the gym, or take any yoga classes to stay fit. Make use of this rare yoga program that is designed especially for men. This challenge claims to provide incredible health benefits and takes only 10 minutes. The program is taught by former punk-rocker-turned-hardcore-yogi Raghunath, who is also a Bhakti yoga teacher.

posts.title: 28-Day Ab Challenge - Blogilates
posts.content: If you want to flaunt those abdomen muscles, engage in this 28-day intense ab routine. Your entire abdomen will be on fire as you work on core-centered exercises. But, make sure you complete this 28-day challenge. At the end of it, you will feel stronger than ever and might even be inspired to give it another try. The challenge consists of 28 different ab workouts and includes everything from criss-cross and boat-crunch to flying plank.

posts.title: 8 Day Yoga Detox Challenge - Brett Larkin Yoga
posts.content: You donâ€™t always need to sip on that ugly-looking green juice to detox. Take this 8-day detox yoga challenge to learn how yoga can be implemented to detox your body. The challenge takes you through a series of yoga poses that will focus on twists, bends, and balance, which are great to detox your body and support your overall health.

title: 25 Jaw-Dropping Natural Phenomena You Wonâ€™t Believe Exist
desc: The mysterious phenomena of our planet Earth will never stop astonishing us. Do you know what a moonbow is? Or a fire rainbow? Can you imagine that something as damaging as a fire tornado even exists? Some natural phenomena are so captivating that you'll feel like you've entered a fairyland, while others are so ghastly that it may give you nightmares if you happened to experience them. Here is a list of such strange natural phenomena that are observed around the world.

posts.title: Flammable Frozen Bubbles
posts.content: These frozen bubbles look like tiny flying saucers that have plummeted into the lake. Found in the Canadian lakes during winter, these gas bubbles are created when dead organic matters are consumed by bacteria that excrete methane. Although they are fairly harmless, these methane infused bubbles can explode if ignited.

posts.title: Blood Falls
posts.content: Unlike its name, this gory waterfall found in Antarctica is not a gush of blood from some mysterious laceration. Studies have revealed that due to high iron content in the water, it literally rusts on contact with air, giving the waterfall the frightening blood-red color.

posts.title: Volcanic Lightning
posts.content: Did you know that volcanoes can produce lightning that may seem like an entrance to hell? But this phenomenon can only take place in volcanic plumes of some erupting volcanoes. During the eruption, the densely-packed tiny particles produce a lot of friction which becomes electrically charged. This naturally occurring activity contributes to volcanic lightning.

posts.title: Fire Rainbow
posts.content: If you find rainbows beautiful, then the rare site of fire rainbows will definitely take your breath away. Fire rainbows or circumhorizontal arcs, are one such occurrences that resembles a colorful abstract painting in the sky. This rare natural wonder occurs when the sun is very high in the sky, and its rays pass through a specific type of ice cloud formation.

posts.title: Sailing Stones
posts.content: Isn't it spooky to see stones weighing hundreds of pounds move by themselves? Well, this terrifying event actually occurs in Californiaâ€™s Death Valley National Park. Although no one has ever seen the sailing stones in action, the deep groove marks that leave a trail behind them indicate that some of these rocks have moved a few hundred meters on their own.

posts.title: Murmurations
posts.content: Have you ever been enthralled by a huge flock of birds fluttering in the sky? Murmurations are a similar phenomenon that occurs when hundreds or thousands of starlings soar in the sky in an intricately coordinated pattern. This complex dance of starlings is executed by some relatively simple rules- watch and follow your neighbor.

posts.title: Lenticular Clouds
posts.content: Can clouds be mistaken for UFOs? Hell, yes. You will be surprised to know that because of their saucer-like shape, some people thought that the lenticular clouds were actual UFOs. Lenticular clouds are lens-shaped clouds that are generally formed where stable moist air flows over a mountain.

posts.title: Skeleton Flowers
posts.content: Have you ever been creeped out by a flower? Well, these flowers may creep you out a bit. Skeleton flowers are pretty looking white-colored flowers that become transparent when drenched in rainwater. The fading of the color is the result of the loose cell structure of the flower, and not because of its color being washed away. The flowers return to their original white color when dried.

posts.title: Bioluminescent Waves
posts.content: Bioluminescence is one of the most spellbinding natural phenomena that is observed in many beaches across the world at night. Many living organisms or phytoplankton are bioluminescent, meaning they convert energy into light energy, and are remarkably noticeable when they are washed ashore by the tides.

posts.title: Light Pillars
posts.content: No, they are not bright enough to be used as a replacement for street lamps! Light pillars are usually seen in the northern regions closer to the Arctic. The tall, narrow rods of light are produced when light from the street lamps hit the ice crystal present in the atmosphere.

posts.title: Rainbow Eucalyptus
posts.content: It may seem like these colorful trees are hand-painted, but mother nature never fails to stupefy us. The most striking feature of this tree is its magnificent bark. As the tree ages and its bark peels off, it reveals fresh, vibrant colors of red, orange, green, blue and gray, making the tree look even more beautiful.

posts.title: Eye of the Sahara
posts.content: A sight to behold, isn't it? The Eye of the Sahara, formerly known as "Richat structure" may look like a 40-km wide UFO which might have once landed on the Sahara Desert. Even today, scientists are not completely sure about how this mysterious geological formation came into existence. This formation is tricky to identify when youâ€™re physically walking over it. It was only discovered by astronauts who were in space.

posts.title: Deep red Lake Natron
posts.content: Only a few things on Earth are as bizarre as the alkaline waters of Lake Natron in Tanzania. The water of the lake is incredibly acidic, and the climate in the region is so harsh that at certain days the temperature rises to 140-degree Fahrenheit (60-degree Celsius). The microbes that survive these deadly climatic conditions give this lake a deep red color. The animals that die in this lake appear stone-like as their body ends up being coated with baking soda and various other chemicals.

posts.title: Spotted Lake
posts.content: Doesn't this lake remind you of the game, Twister? Located in British Columbia, Canada, the Spotted Lake looks spectacular in its polka dot pattern during summers. In summers, when most of the water of this mineral-rich lake evaporates, the residue that's left behind is a huge concentration of salt and other minerals. This further forms circles of various sizes in shades of green, yellow and brown.

posts.title: Desert Roses
posts.content: If your imaginations took you to the pretty sight of a desert laden with roses, then we are extremely sorry! Desert Rose is the name given to the rose-like formations of the mineral gypsum that develop in dry sandy places that flood from time to time. These gypsum crystals are created amidst grains of sand during the evaporation process.

posts.title: Moonbows
posts.content: Who said that you can only see a rainbow during the daytime? Moonbows look and form the same way as rainbows. They are colorful arches that are created when light from the moon reflects and refracts off water droplets in the sky. However, moonbows are quite rare and occur only when the specific criteria of their formation are met.

posts.title: Salar de Uyuni
posts.content: Salar de Uyuni is the largest salt flat on Earth that was naturally formed when an ancient lake dried up about 30,000 years ago. It stretches over 4,000 square miles and appears like an endless sheet of white hexagonal tiles. One good use of this natural phenomenon is that it provides more than 25,000 tons of salt to local miners and helps in feeding thousands of flamingos.

posts.title: Waterspouts
posts.content: It may look like a tornado over a water surface. Waterspouts are a rare type of cloud formation. They are a narrow column of rapidly whirling air in contact with the water surface. This natural phenomenon can be seen in various shapes and is mostly produced by quickly expanding cumulus clouds.

posts.title: Singing Sand
posts.content: Can sand sing? Asking you again. Can sand even sing? Well, it seems like they do in very few parts of the world! This kind of sand is quite rare and scientists are not entirely sure how these odd noises are produced. Researchers state that when grains of sand are pushed down the slope of certain sand dunes either by humans or wind, they produce a deep, groaning, eerie hum that is heard miles away. Creepy, isn't it?

posts.title: Clonal Tree Groves
posts.content: Itâ€™s quite easy to mistake this beautiful land for a forest, in reality, itâ€™s just a single tree. Yes, you read it right. Beneath the land, 47,000 tree roots are interconnected across 100 acres. This particular grove, located in Utahâ€™s Fishlake National Forest, is nicknamed Pando and is among the oldest and largest organisms in the world.

posts.title: Lake Maracaibo Thunderstorms
posts.content: Itâ€™s petrifying to get through one night of continuous thunderstorm, right? This lake in Venezuela records the most amount of lightning strikes on the planet with thunderstorms appearing for a total of 300 days in a year. This phenomenon is the result of the hot and humid climate of the area; electricity gets generated when the cool breeze clashes with moist air.

posts.title: The Wave, Arizona
posts.content: The Wave is a geological wonder characterized by the swooping lines of gold, yellow and rusty red color. Discovered on the slopes of the Coyote Buttes at Arizona-Utah border, the formation of the Wave dates back to the Jurassic era during which winds and rains worked their magic, eroding lines that swirl across the sandstone formation.

posts.title: Underwater Waterfall
posts.content: Does an underwater waterfall even exist? Not really! But it may very well seem to appear as an optical illusion in the southern tip of Mauritius. This stunning natural phenomenon is caused when the sand is driven off the shores by ocean currents down to the depth of the ocean floor.

posts.title: Lake Hillier
posts.content: Seems like nature is trying to mess with us by creating a wonder like Lake Hillier in Australia. What might have caused this strange Australian lake to acquire the bubble gum pink color? Scientists explain that the pink hue is the result of the unusual form of salt-loving microbes that are present in this lake.

posts.title: Columnar Basalt, Ireland
posts.content: There are different ways in which each volcano lava cools down. Among them, one of the most striking examples is of the columnar basalts in Irelandâ€™s Giantâ€™s Causeway which forms hexagonal columns after the cooling process. Over 40,000 interlocking basalt columns that have structured themselves like steps lead downwards to the Atlantic Ocean.

title: 29 Work-from-home Memes That You Can Laugh-cry At

Whatâ€™s to love is the fact that we can attend meetings in our lounge clothes (Itâ€™s 2020 no one wears pants anymore!) but on the other hand, keeping track of time is a mammoth task. Irrespective of how you feel about it, one sure-fire way to express anything in the 21st century with surprising accuracy, is memes. Giggle at them or sigh at them from the innermost depths of your soul, here are some memes that capture the very essence of our work-from-home experiences.
