title: Ingenious Teachers Find Ingenious Ways to Engage Students Online
desc: Online learning is a constantly evolving process. At least thatâ€™s what teachers and professors who teach in various schools and colleges have realized amidst the unforeseen circumstances that call for virtual learning. Despite being holed up at home, the studentsâ€™ spirits are high as teachers have come up with some interesting ways to keep them engaged online. While one professor decided that rapping in his virtual class would certainly get their attention, another teacher came up with an ingenious plan to add outdoor adventure while being indoors!We have scoured the Internet to find these amazing teachers who stop at nothing to ensure their students continue to learn. Take a look.

posts.title: The first day
posts.content:
This pre k Zoom meeting with 22 four year olds is not very productive, but itâ€™s super duper cute. ???? pic.twitter.com/aoBXjTwGOw

— Lindsay Kaplan (@lindsaykap) March 23, 2020
The first day is always the hardest, especially with a class full of kindergarten children. Only the teacher knows what they are up for. This also explains why this teacher decided to have a cute first meeting with all her students online just to see how they were doing before getting started on the curriculum.

posts.title: Free Wi-Fi for students
posts.content:
Free WiFi for students pic.twitter.com/tRDsBLtt8V

— Jane Baker (@jcat2009) March 28, 2020
This is certainly a great initiative sponsored by several Internet service providers as communication is crucial for online learning. The Science Education Specialist Jane Baker shared an active Wi-Fi connection link on social media hoping to enable students to gain access to uninterrupted Internet.

posts.title: A clever workaround
posts.content:
My professor is 74 and he isnâ€™t confident using Zoom so heâ€™s prerecorded the rest of our classes. Today, I watched the first one. He has a Pinocchio doll in the front row because he isnâ€™t comfortable teaching to an empty room. Iâ€™m social distancing for this man and this man only. pic.twitter.com/2HvG3xhrTt

— montana (@macho_montana) March 22, 2020
There are tons of tools available for teachers to take an online class. However, when you hit a snag with these tools, do what this elderly college professor did. Since he did not feel comfortable with live streaming for conducting a virtual lecture, the professor at UNC Law pre-recorded all of his upcoming lectures. He then uploaded the recordings and interacted with students online.

posts.title: Applause for a cause
posts.content:
Week 1 of eLearning down; and BOTH of my boys were Star of the Week. My teacher,mommy heart is full???????????? pic.twitter.com/CdTOAcns0r

— Katie R Lewis (@Mrs_KatieLewis) March 28, 2020
This teacher definitely went the extra mile to say â€œkeep up the good work.â€ Katie Lewis of Windermere School posted regularly about the tasks assigned to her students and congratulated them for adapting well to online learning. This sure is a great way to motivate children!

posts.title: Live poetry
posts.content:
What day do your bin men arrive with a biff, bang, biff bang bash?

Source - Poems For The Very Young, selected by Michael Rosen and Illustrated by Bob Graham. The Dustman by Clive Sansom. #windermereschool #childrenspoetry #poetry #weareallinthistogether #feelinspired pic.twitter.com/EmKBCl3p2Y

— Windermere School (@windermeresc) March 26, 2020
Lessons can get boring after a couple of hours of staring at the screen, which is why this teacher from Windermere School started uploading videos of dramatic prose and poetry to keep things interesting during every session. Shakespeare would be proud!

posts.title: Prodigy
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

My youngest had his first Zoom meeting with his first grade class today. I loved seeing his face light up when he saw his teacher and classmates. #conejovalleykids #distancelearning #805moms #805dads

A post shared by Rebecca Woolley (@ms.rebecca.np) on Mar 26, 2020 at 6:31pm PDT

Online learning is not just limited to lessons and lectures. One of the toughest subjects for students to take interest in is mathematics. It is one of the reasons why many companies, including Prodigy, are offering their innovative problem based learning solutions virtually free of cost. Prodigy combines gaming and mathematics to make online learning highly interactive.

posts.title: Classroom wallpaper
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

I set a picture of our classroom as my background on Zoom. ???? â£ â£ I havenâ€™t done any live chats with my class yet, but Iâ€™ve been using Zoom to record myself reading chapters from the read aloud that we started before break, and then sending it out to them.â£ â£ The kids all got a kick out of it! â£ A little piece of our classroom home. ???? . . . @zoom.uni #iteachtoo #virtualteacher #homeschoollife

A post shared by Starlaâœ¨Teacherâœ¨Oilerâœ¨Dreamerâœ¨ (@starla_kennelly) on Mar 23, 2020 at 2:25pm PDT

This has to be one of the most engaging ideas to keep that classroom vibe alive. Starla Kennelly from Fort Myers, Florida, pre-recorded her lessons using Zoom but with a genius twist. Her video background was the picture of the actual classroom to make everyone feel like they were sitting in their classroom while going over the course online.

posts.title: Online classroom
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Well after not using my schools online platform nearly all year- Iâ€™ve been thrown into it full force and am wondering why I havenâ€™t used it sooner! Iâ€™m learning so many â€œtechâ€ things this week and Iâ€™m proud of myself for trying new things and pushing myself to learn things that are hard. My favorite learning tools so far have been screencastify and google forms!

A post shared by Kelsey//Third Grade Reading (@myclassbloom) on Mar 26, 2020 at 2:40pm PDT

Many schools and educational institutions have their own online learning platforms that come in handy when schools are shut down. The entire course curriculum can be taught using these platforms to children who are already comfortable at home. They contain great infographics and interactive learning techniques to keep children engaged.

posts.title: Special mention
posts.content:
SIGN OF THE TIMES: Special education teachers in Shepherdsville, KY teaching deaf students by sitting at their front doors during coronavirus outbreak. @WDRBNews @AmericanASL @NyleDiMarco #ASL pic.twitter.com/WYopOiYSkl

â€” Joel Schipper (@JSchipperWDRB) March 25, 2020
These special education teachers wanted their students to learn every single day, despite their schools remaining shut. This is why they carried on with the teaching to ensure that the kids stayed engaged. Using sign language, they continued to impart wisdom and knowledge to their students who were hard of hearing.

posts.title: You have a new message!
posts.content:
Teachers in New York recorded uplifting messages for students, reminding them to keep their minds and bodies active during the coronavirus crisis pic.twitter.com/voitjAkumw#FBR

— Tomthunkitâ„¢ (@TomthunkitsMind) March 29, 2020
While teachers made sure that children were not behind on their studies with virtual classrooms, it was also necessary to keep the students, especially the young ones, motivated. These teachers came together to record uplifting messages asking them to stay strong, healthy, and always smile no matter how bad the situation was.

posts.title: One-on-one conversations
posts.content:
Kids, like adults, find it hard to tolerate the uncertainty about when schools will reopen. Teachers should validate the difficulty of the situation and reassure students that they will provide more information as soon as itâ€™s known. @KaraNewhouse https://t.co/J1ltzzAvg9

â€” MindShift (@MindShiftKQED) March 29, 2020
Itâ€™s one thing to talk to a classroom full of students and a completely different thing to have one-on-one discussions. Elizabeth Raff, who teaches the 6th grade in Penn Manor School District, asked her students to send messages and emails about their progress to which she promised to reply. As an educator, she understands the importance of one-on-one discussions.

posts.title: A musical adventure
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

#guitarteaching #videoteach #teachingvideos #covidteaching #teachingduringcoronavirus #coronavirusteaching #charliekager #gitarrenschule #coronateacherchallenge #stayathome #stayathomestudent #inspiteofcoronavirus

A post shared by Charlie Kager (@charliekager) on Mar 28, 2020 at 3:25pm PDT

With popular apps like Yousician, many students are learning to play instruments online. Charlie Kager, a teacher ensured that his students didnâ€™t fall back on their music syllabus. Here, we have the guitarist and his online class jamming a quarter note at a time to perfection.

posts.title: Storytelling
posts.content:
I hope youâ€™re in your PJâ€™s because itâ€™s time for tonightâ€™s bedtime story! @LoriAHiggins @principallearns @mrsbrown712 @bow_warren @GreenfieldUnion @Detroitk12 @DavisonMiddle @HoganZetia @SirJoshBennett @PrincipalKafele @ pic.twitter.com/wluyGnSqeE

— Voncile Campbell M.Ed (@CampbellVoncile) March 29, 2020
Voncile Campbell from Detroit Michigan certainly found an innovative way to keep her students engaged online after schools were shut down in Detroit, Michigan. Every night at 8, she started a storytelling session on the schoolâ€™s official Facebook page. This math teacher transformed into whichever character or narration she picked for that night and thoroughly entertained the kids.

posts.title: Free English classes
posts.content:
An English teacher has amassed thousands of followers worldwide after just three online lessons during the coronavirus pandemic. via @BBCNews https://t.co/R13exgjAsw #HomeSchooling pic.twitter.com/Hpcps2AfIY

— Caroline Cavanagh (@AnxietyExpertCC) March 30, 2020
Holly King-Mand from Bedfordshire in the UK gained a massive fan following on social media after posting just three English lessons on her Facebook page. Her free 30-minute video sessions garnered thousands of followers from all over the world as people struggled to find accessible study material when schools were shut down.

posts.title: Fitness 101
posts.content:
NEWS: An Isle of Wight teacher has launched a YouTube channel to help children who are at home during the coronavirus pandemic to stay fit...https://t.co/aJXCfGWnzg #iow #iwnews #isleofwight

— Isle of Wight Radio (@iwightradio) March 30, 2020
One teacher from the Isle of Wight launched his home fitness workout series for exercising indoors. It started out as a simple Google Classroom initiative by Ashley Brett. But, later, the videos became a popular online resource on YouTube that motivated young ones to take up fitness when they were stuck at home on the small island.

posts.title: Zoom class
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

First day of virtual teaching!!! I was able to meet with most most of my students... I missed their little faces!! A post shared by Jae Butler (@jae_elle_bea) on Mar 24, 2020 at 5:53am PDT

After much deliberation and efforts, it does feel great to see the students all in one place (on-screen of course) when schools are unable to operate. In fact, this was just the first day and judging by the looks on their faces, these third graders sure do seem happy to start learning online.

posts.title: Dance your heart out
posts.content:
Teachers at a Stoke-on-Trent school are hoping to make their pupils smile during the coronavirus pandemic. Students are all at home and it's safe to say that they are missing school, the classroom vibe, and their favorite teachers. So to cheer them up, these teachers from Stoke on Trent school created a hilarious dance video that features Rend Collectiveâ€™s â€˜My Lighthouseâ€™ song.

posts.title: Sing along
posts.content:
WOW! A Pee Dee Elementary teacher took a "Frozen 2" song and transformed it into a supportive song for her students during the #coronavirus pandemic. Read more here: https://t.co/VzGne0BSUu #SCTweets pic.twitter.com/vjA8ElfP33

This teacherâ€™s commitment to teaching knows no bounds and she found an interesting way to both entertain and motivate students. posts.title: Dressed to the nine
posts.content:
This amazing 2nd grade teacher Jasmine Chase is using @Disney as a way to make her students (who are at home) smile. She wants to bring light and hope during this difficult time. Story tonight @kpaxnews @KAJNews #coronavirus #Disney #Ariel #SocialDistancing pic.twitter.com/p40ryslvIJ

— Maren Siu KAJ (@marenmsiu) March 31, 2020
She knew her children loved Disney characters and to keep them thoroughly entertained while teaching online, Jasmine Chase, a second grade teacher, dressed up as Disney characters while interacting with her students. She hoped that this way, they would be amused and attentive during class.

These teachers of Voorhees Middle School created a hilarious parody of the F.R.I.E.N.D.S theme song for their students. Nearly 40 of the school staff recorded bits of the Rembrandts famous opening theme â€œIâ€™ll Be There For Youâ€ and put together this awesome clip to boost their morale.

posts.title: All the tools you need
posts.content:
One Stillwater elementary teacher says sheâ€™s starting to put together tools like Google Docs to help students continue to learn. She says itâ€™s important for parents teaching at home during #coronavirus to first respond to a childâ€™s emotional needs. pic.twitter.com/H4NvfPyiD4

— Will Maetzold (@WMaetzold) March 30, 2020
While continuing to take virtual classes, this teacher from Stillwater Elementary also put together useful information for both her students and their parents on Google docs to ensure that the children continued to learn.

posts.title: Master of puppets
posts.content: Bonnie Bhasin found out a great way to teach her class and keep them entertained with puppets. Thatâ€™s right! She was joined by Kermit the Frog, Cookie Monster, and Elmo, just to name a few, who took lessons with their puppet master. This online class was surely a hit among her students as they got their assignments from their beloved childhood characters.

title: Inspirational Quotes to Get You Through Quarantine
desc: Social distancing is not easy, and more so when itâ€™s not by choice. Whether or not weâ€™re fortunate enough to be staying with our families or friends, social isolation can take a toll on our morale. During these trying times, restlessness and anxiety are common. While efforts are continual, we donâ€™t know when the pandemic will die down, but we can definitely choose to not lose hope until then. To help you along the way, we have curated a list of the best inspirational quotes.

posts.title: Laughter in the time of a pandemic
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Donâ€™t screw this up.

A post shared by Word Porn (@wordporm) on Mar 28, 2020 at 8:17pm PDT

This is for those who still think social isolation is just not cool for them. There might never be another opportunity in our lifetimes to just laze around the house, go on a Netflix marathon, and save the world while doing it! Just stay home, break the chain, and flatten that curve. This is the kind of superhero all of us would gladly become.

posts.title: To not lose hope
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Better days will come. The pandemic is only just beginning, but one dayâ€”a better dayâ€”youâ€™ll tell your kids about it. via @minna_so Pay attention to whateverâ€”or whoeverâ€”you thought about when you read this. âœ¨

A post shared by MAISON DE FEMMES â˜¾ JEWELLERY (@maisondefemmes) on Mar 24, 2020 at 1:01am PDT

We are all under quarantine, across the world, and there is a constant influx of COVID-19 updates wherever we turn. Most of these updates, although necessary, can be quite disheartening. After all, how long do we have to wait for things to get better? But, you know what? The world has faced pandemics worse than this. This too shall pass, and weâ€™ll wake up to better days down the line.

posts.title: Some undeniable truth
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

I read this quote aloud during the meditation I guided this morning and got several messages about it afterwards with people wanting to find it or relating so I figured I would share it for you all here as well. â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€” A few days ago I was feeling overwhelmed by all the digital options I was coming acrossâ€”so many ads for courses being promoted my way, brands suggesting their products as assets, virtual hangouts, the news, 10x the number of posts as usual, and just social-media-ing in general for lack of a better word. A part of me finds great comfort in the ways in which weâ€™ve found to connect and create community during this challenging time. It gives me hope and Iâ€™m in awe of everyone stepping up. But I also want to remind anyone out there that needs to hear it that itâ€™s also ok to just BE. To get in touch with who YOU are without all that you define yourself with. I want to remind you that youâ€™re just as valuable and worthy sitting on your couch eating cookies as you are writing the next great American novel. Sometimes I forget that too and it sends me spinning. And sometimes we just need a little space and time to process things. So hereâ€™s your reminder. Love you all ???? [and I recognize the luxury I have to be able to be safe at home during this time] p.s. thanks @sarabareilles - I love you & thank you @emmazeck_ for your gorgeous words

A post shared by K A R A C O N N O L L Y (@karaconnolly) on Mar 22, 2020 at 9:02pm PDT

Do you remember the days before this forced lockdown? We were always in a rush. To get to work, to finish up that presentation, to get that raise, to get back home; always running and always trying to avoid rush hour. Perhaps this is our chance to pause and enjoy the quiet around us. Grab the opportunity, cause we might not have a second chance at this!

posts.title: This one speaks to our heart
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Today, I joined with members of my faith @churchofjesuschrist and friends around the world in a global day of fasting & prayer, for relief from the emotional, physical & economic hardships cause by COVID-19. ???????? My heartâ€™s been full today, as Iâ€™ve focused on praying for this purpose. It prompted me to share a heartfelt post on The Friday Blog. âœ¨ I gathered several â€œQuotes to get you through Quarantine,â€ and sized them to be IG Stories, so you can save & share the ones that speak to you. I hope we can all join in prayer today, hoping for the future and believing in miracles. ???? *Link to The Friday Blog in our Story.

A post shared by Friday Apparelâ„¢ (@shopfridayapparel) on Mar 29, 2020 at 4:19pm PDT

We are all waiting for things to get back to normal. Thereâ€™s still a long way to go for that, but it doesnâ€™t mean we have to despair. There can be joy even in waiting, like the proverbial light at the end of the tunnel.

posts.title: Look at the bright side
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Call me an extreme optimist, but I believe that amidst complete disruption, wonderful things are at work. â € â € Unforeseeable things. â € â € Intangible things. â € â € I believe that we can all come out of this intense period of disruption having bloomed, grown, or expanded in some way. â € â € Weâ€™ve got the worlds biggest mirror placed right in front of us, reflecting back to us who weâ€™ve been and how weâ€™ve operated. Giving many of us the chance to reinvent and plant seeds of who weâ€™d like to be and how weâ€™d like to operate in the future. â € â € Call me an extreme optimist but one day you will look back on all of this and see how that one time, when you were sheltered at home, you realized what really mattered and decided to become who you are now. â € â € â €

A post shared by Jordan Laine Thomson (@jordanpthomson) on Mar 30, 2020 at 6:19am PDT

The time that has been given to us right now is more precious than we know. Staying in doesnâ€™t mean we are stagnant. This is the time to contemplate every little thing we do. This is the time to cherish our close and intimate relationships. And this is the time to do everything we wanted to but never found the time to do. Despite the pause, we can grow and bloom.

posts.title: Contemplate on this
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Heard this on the radio and had to share...

A post shared by Jaalyn Washington (@jaalynwash) on Mar 29, 2020 at 10:30am PDT

Many of us are thinking about what we would do once things are back to normal, but what exactly is normal? The new normal during quarantine has made us think about everything, right from our routines to our needs. The habits of impulsive online shopping, rushing our meals, and so many other things seem completely unnecessary now. Knowing this might help us come out of this as better versions of ourselves.

posts.title: When itâ€™s time to take a pause
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

And sometimes one HOUR at a time ???? . PC: @quotesbychristie

A post shared by KELLI FRANCE | Empower Women (@kellifrance) on Mar 24, 2020 at 9:49am PDT

Several countries have been extending their lockdown periods in a bid to control the spread of the infection, and a lot of us donâ€™t know how long we will have to remain indoors. The long quarantine may seem overwhelming and frustrating, but everything becomes easier if we take one day at a time and enjoy the present moment.

posts.title: Breathe in, breathe out
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Well itâ€™s finally happened everyone, I hope everyone stays safe and well and sane! Reach out to everyone while youâ€™re locked up as so many people will struggle without human contact, luckily Iâ€™m a little hermit and crave isolation in normal life. This is the time to focus attention on other things - fitness, gardening, learn a language, do a puzzle! #lockdownhobbies #quarantinequotes #pinkquotes #pinkaesthetic #reachout

A post shared by Nadine Bousfield (@nadine_bousfield) on Mar 23, 2020 at 11:21pm PDT

Doing things one day at a time and living mindfully is how we deal with anxiety. Social isolation is overwhelming, but it doesnâ€™t mean we let our feelings get the better of us. What happens around us is not in our control, but the way we deal with the situation surely is. So face the quarantine mindfully and make the best of this time.

posts.title: The one with all warm stuff
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Here is your positivity page for today. hang in there! #bujo #bulletjournaling #handlettered #bulletjournal #handlettering #drawing #art #pretty #creative #positivity #quarantinequotes #happy #joy #nature #sketchbook #pigmamicron #bujoinspiration #bujolove #positivitypage # #handlettering #bulletjournal #bujo

A post shared by Jane Maday (@janemaday) on Mar 28, 2020 at 9:17am PDT

The news and updates are constantly telling us about the downward course of the global economy, closing down of businesses, loss of pay, and casualties due to COVID-19. When in our worst state of mind, we may feel that the world is about to end. But remember that every ending leads to a beginning.

posts.title: Let there be peace
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Or maybe now is a good time to start for those of us who haven't. #grateful #gratitude #smallpleasures #mondaymusings #blessed #thanksomeonetoday #quarantinequotes #justathought???? #positivity #littlethingsmatter #mindbodysoul #gofindyourselfyoga

A post shared by Jo | Yoga Teacher (@gofindyourself.yoga) on Mar 30, 2020 at 7:35am PDT

These are trying times, and for those who have not been through worse in human history, living under quarantine may seem terrible. But it has given us the opportunity to count our blessings. When we come out of this, weâ€™ll be thankful for so many things around us that we had failed to appreciate earlier.

posts.title: The one that stills the heart
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

These are challenging times. Iâ€™ve realised life has its own way of testing our will. Either my having nothing happen at all or by having everything happen at one. â€¢ â€¢ Sending love and positive vibes your way ???????? Stay strong ???????? . . Follow @browngirlbooktique for book reviews and recommendations â­ï¸ . Art via @fullspiritquotes . . #bookstagram #bookstagrammer #booksofinstagram #followforbooks #quotes #lifequotes #quarantinequotes #quaratineatruggles

A post shared by BrowngirlBooktique (@browngirlbooktique) on Mar 27, 2020 at 3:07am PDT

At times, staying strong may feel like the hardest thing to do. With bad news drowning us and no idea of knowing when it will end, the situation may make you crumble inside. But, not crumbling is a choice, even if it doesnâ€™t feel right.

posts.title: Chaos no more
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Who's with me on this one? Work on continuing self improvement. Better hsbits equals better results.

A post shared by millionaire.incorporated (@millionaire.incorporated) on Mar 30, 2020 at 5:35am PDT

Living one day at a time is easier said than done; how do you actually do it? Just give time to yourself. Use all the time you have right now to do the things you have been wanting to doâ€”pick up that book you left midway, learn a new language, make healthy meals, or just dance and sing your heart out.

posts.title: To live and to love
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

I have noticed this so much this past week. In my own personal life and on social media. Itâ€™s been a beautiful thing to witness. We are stronger together. â¤ï¸ . #quarantinequotes #highfitness #ilovehighfitness #quarantine #strongertogether #rockwalltx #dallastx #heathtx #groupfitnessinstructor

A post shared by Ashley Jones | FITNESS (@ashleyjonesfitness) on Mar 22, 2020 at 8:27am PDT

Social distancing is only physical distancing, and it doesnâ€™t mean you have to literally isolate yourself. After all, no man is an island! Most of us are far away from our families and friends, so pick up that phone and call a loved one, or catch up with all your friends or cousins through group video conferencing. We are far, yet we are close!

posts.title: Be kind
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

. . . . #quotestoliveby #quoteoftheday #quotestagram #quotestoliveby #positiveaffirmations #positivethoughts #selflove #foodforsoul #innerpeace #bemindful # gratitudeattitude #positiveselftalk #soulgrowth #affirmations #quarantinelife #quarantinequotes

A post shared by A L I N A (@alina_wally) on Mar 28, 2020 at 10:31am PDT

Living mindfully and being kind is how we can get through the quarantine easily. We have to be kind to ourselves as well as those around us. At the end of the day, we are all in this despairing period together. The inability to go out may make us feel extremely helpless, but staying indoors can be a blessing too.

posts.title: Let there be light
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Even when A LOT of things are going wrong. Very, very wrong.... . Turn around. Look around. See the good. Itâ€™s still there and even though you have to work harder to focus on it, you should try. Itâ€™s worth it ???? . Share something good thatâ€™s coming from all this for you! ????????

A post shared by Health Coach & Biz Mentor (@marissa_unruh) on Mar 26, 2020 at 3:55pm PDT

How do we keep the flicker of hope alive when everything seems to be going wrong and the world outside is chaotic? Just breathe and focus on things that are going right for you. Express gratitude for what you have, no matter how little that might be. You never know, good things might be right round the corner.

posts.title: Never say never
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Sunday Musings - Sending Love And Support To Everyone ????

A post shared by GÊ€á´‡á´›á´„Êœá´‡É´ ???? (@theplannerfreak) on Mar 22, 2020 at 8:18am PDT

Staying in for longer periods can take a toll on our mental health and affect how we feel about everything. It may seem easier to wallow in helplessness, but we need to remember that humankind has been through worse. Collectively and individually, we are strong enough to get through this as well.

title: International Carnivals and Festivals That Deserve to be on Your Bucket List
desc: Celebration holds the same significance and meaning in all languages. What changes is how people celebrate to honor a long-standing tradition or how they mark the beginning or end of a festival. Some of the best carnivals and festivals celebrated around the world showcase the most intriguing music, performances, and events. And to top that, you get to indulge in finger-licking food and the best drinks to go with them! We bring you the thirty top carnivals and festivals in the world, in no particular order, each with its own piquancy that makes it a must-experience event.

posts.title: Venice Carnival
posts.content: Right from the grand opening to the conclusion, the Venice Carnival features an extensive lineup of festivities for both locals and travelers. With the Festa Veneziana marking the beginning of the carnival, the opening day features a water parade of Venetians wearing masks and costumes. Then come the Best Mask Contest, The Flight of the Angel in the iconic St. Markâ€™s Square, The Flight of the Eagle at St. Markâ€™s Basilicaâ€™s clock tower, and the Mascheranda Grand Ball that ends the carnival with a bang.

posts.title: Mardi Gras in New Orleans
posts.content: Mardi Gras (French for Fat Tuesday) is a festival celebrated in New Orleans before Lent begins according to the Christian Calendar. On the Tuesday before the 46-day fast that runs right up to Easter, a colorful mix of giant parades, floats, music, and huge crowds brings in the festive cheer. Of course, thereâ€™s also tons of fatty food on the famous Fat Tuesday before fasting begins.

posts.title: International Carnival Parade
posts.content: Amid the colorful chaos of floats and masked people, you will witness a centuries-old tradition unfold at the Rijecki Karneval. The festival brings together urban and traditional carnival groups celebrating the masking tradition in the Croatian Littoral. Even if you canâ€™t make it for the duration of the entire carnival, you can always catch The International Carnival Parade, the crown jewel of festivities for both Croatians and tourists in the city along the Rje?ina River.

posts.title: Port of Spain Carnival
posts.content: Like most carnivals, this one in Spain honors Greek orthodox and Western Christian cultures with festive indulgence before Lent. Wait right there before you think itâ€™s a religious event! The Trinidad and Tobago carnival honors the Caribbean culture with calypso and soca performances and several competitions throughout the festival. So, pull on your elaborate costumes, join the locals in the spirit of celebration, and make merry!

posts.title: Rio Carnival
posts.content: The Rio Carnival is one of the biggest and most popular festivals in the South American continent that attracts millions of tourists all year round. With festivities influenced by the Portuguese and European traditions, you get to celebrate the Brazilian way. Simply groove to Samba music along the colorful costume-dominated streets of Rio, attend carnival balls for a night of gala, or do both for an unforgettable experience.

posts.title: Basel Carnival
posts.content: The â€œthree best days of the yearâ€ as referred to by the locals of Basel, the carnival starts on the morning of the Monday after Ash Wednesday. This unique carnival setting is a culmination of music, creativity, and performances that showcase major socio-political topics, current events, and stories with humor and sharp wit.

posts.title: Oruro Carnival
posts.content: Imagine the grandeur of over 30,000 costumed performers singing and dancing together in a 4-km long procession to celebrate the Virgin of the Candle Mass. In the Oruro Carnival, performers also reenact the fight between Good and Evil, and you can engage in the festive treats during the four days of the festival reflecting Christian beliefs and ancient Aymara traditions.

posts.title: Carnaval de Salvador
posts.content: Head to the state of Bahia to experience the true fusion of African and Brazilian folklore, dance, and music. Millions flock to this city to witness the musical galore with African drummers and Afro-Brazilian pop. One of the unique features of this carnival is the Trio Electricos, motorized floats that parade all the singers and musicians along the streets of Salvador. You can also groove to some AxÃ© music without shelling out a penny and soak yourself in the festivities.

posts.title: Barranquilla Carnival
posts.content: The second largest carnival in South America after Rio De Janeiro, this festival showcases the folklore and heritage-rich culture of Colombia. The festivities begin with 6 hours of folk dancing, fire breathing, live music, and colorful floats moving along the streets of Barranquilla. While youâ€™re there, you can mingle with the locals, listen to the folktales of Barranquilla, and taste traditional food and spirits. Now thatâ€™s called an authentic and invaluable experience!

posts.title: Binche Carnival
posts.content: Come the Sunday before Ash Wednesday and itâ€™s a blast of colors in the small city of Binche with the costume parade. Thousands of people put on a show for nearly half a million visitors in this 3-day festival, and the biggest crowd-pleaser is costumed performers called Gilles. Their costumes are unique in their design and feature bright suits embroidered with heraldic symbols, large hats with ostrich plumes, and clogs.

posts.title: Santa Cruz de Tenerife
posts.content: Once every year, Tenerife goes absolutely wild with celebrations that continue for 15 days. The streets of Santa Cruz and Puerto de la Cruz buzz with parades, the Queenâ€™s election, and shows, all to be followed by endless street parties. You have only one thing to doâ€”dress up in your favorite costumes and join the locals as they hit the streets to partaayy!
posts.image_credit: Mercedes Menendez/Pacific Press Via Zuma Wire/Shutterstock

posts.title: DÃ¼sseldorf Carnival
posts.content: The DÃ¼sseldorf Carnival begins at the city hall with Narrenschelte (known as the Jesterâ€™s Scolding) by Hoppeditz, a fictional character who is the arch prankster of DÃ¼sseldorf. This is followed by the Altweiberfastnacht (womenâ€™s carnival day), the childrenâ€™s and youth procession, the informal street carnival with costumes, and the final grand procession featuring colorful themed floats of satirist Jacques Tilly.
posts.image_credit: Simone Kuhlmey/Pacific Press Via Zuma Wire/Shutterstock

posts.title: Carnaval de MazatlÃ¡n
posts.content: Carnaval de MazatlÃ¡n is one of the merriest carnivals in Mexico that takes place for 6 days before Ash Wednesday in the state of Sinaloa. You can groove to the tunes of the tambora and witness a spectacular sight of brass bands throughout the carnival. And whatâ€™s MazatlÃ¡n without flavorful Pacifico beer? So, grab a cold one, join the parade and coronation shows, and enter the party zone!

posts.title: CÃ¡diz Carnival
posts.content: CÃ¡diz welcomes enthusiastic patrons and participants to one of the biggest street festivals in Spain, where celebration and fun transform the city for 11 days. The Gran Cabalgata is the first parade held on the first Sunday of the carnival and attracts massive crowds. So go ahead and join the locals in the boisterous celebration with music, food, street shows, and fireworks in the mainland.
posts.image_credit: Mercedes Menendez/Pacific Press Via Zuma Wire/Shutterstock

posts.title: Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras
posts.content: Get ready to experience the most memorable gay and lesbian festival down under at Sydney. This bustling extravaganza of theater, workshops, dance parties, and family-focused fun opens up a whole new world of Sydneyâ€™s queer nightlife. Celebrated with much pomp and flair, Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras continues to be one of the most important LGBTQI organizations operating in the Australian subcontinent.

posts.title: Cologne Carnival
posts.content: The Cologne Carnival also goes by the name â€œthe fifth season of the yearâ€ and features the iconic â€œcrazy daysâ€ with parties on the streets, in public squares, and in pubs. Letâ€™s say youâ€™ll most likely walk into a party while exiting another. Rose Monday, the highlight of this street carnival, is part of a tradition that dates back nearly 2,000 years in the rich history of the city. So, we ask, are you ready to celebrate, sing, dance, and go absolutely bonkers for the next 6 days of festivities?

posts.title: Vincy Mas of St. Vincent and the Grenadines
posts.content: The Vincy Mas is a colorful fiesta of local calypso and soca music in the southern islands of St. Vincent and the Grenadines. The hottest carnival in the Caribbean, Vincy Mas is all set to make you sweat in the summer month of June. Head to the city of Kingstown to witness a lively gathering of fashionable Vincentians dressed up to the nines amid the ambiance of music and festivities.

posts.title: Barbados Crop Over Festival
posts.content: Experiencing the Barbados Crop Over Festival is one of the most lively and colorful things to do during the summer months on the eastern Caribbean Island. The 200-year-old traditional festival is celebrated over 6 weeks with all night long parties to honor the end of the sugar cane season. The key highlight is the Grand Kadooment Day that marks the end of the Crop Over and features masquerade bands moving along the Spring Garden highway.

posts.title: Toronto Caribana
posts.content: The Toronto Caribana is the largest Caribbean carnival in the Northern hemisphere of the Americas. Be there in the month of August to enjoy pool parties, watch celebrity performances, groove to music in amazing nightlife events, and experience the Grand Parade. Now thatâ€™s how you soak in the infectious vibe of festivities and celebration!

posts.title: Notting Hill Carnival
posts.content: The Notting Hill carnival features an explosive setting of sound systems, Brazilian and steel bands, and live stages and floats for acclaimed artists in the heart of London city. There is a rich history associated with the humble beginnings of this Caribbean themed carnival. Claudia Jones laid the foundation for these festivities at St. Pancras Town Hall in 1959.

posts.title: Carnival of Nice
posts.content: The first cultural event in the French Riviera during the winter months is also one of the most popular attractions in the city of Nice. You get to discover (or rediscover if you fell in love the first time!) the charming city of Nice with an exclusive lineup of majestic parades in CÃ´te d'Azur. Join the millions attending this winter carnival from all over the globe to witness the cityâ€™s riot of colors.

posts.title: Sitges Carnival
posts.content: Ranked among the top ten carnivals in the world, this is hosted by the city of Sitges, located southwest of Barcelona. The city welcomes locals and tourists for 7 days every year to celebrate with shows, parades, and street dancing. It is here that you will also witness the Spanish rendition of Mardi Gras, the Sitges Gay Carnival, just 4 days before the Sitges Carnival festivities in the winter months of Europe.

posts.title: Northampton Carnival
posts.content: Experience the best of parade floats, performance troupes, stage performances, and stalls in the most awaited carnival in the local town of Northampton, United Kingdom. The carnival unites the community of Northampton, and people from all around flock to the heart of the town to enjoy the enormous funfair, Carribean food, art and craft, dance groups and choirs, and bands. Whatâ€™s more? Thereâ€™s also a full running bar!

posts.title: Aalborg Carnival
posts.content: The biggest festival in Northern Europe, the Aalborg Carnival in the city of Denmark caters to nearly 60,000 participants and entertains over 100,000 spectators every year. You ask why Denmark of all places? We say because you can be more than a mere spectator here. Itâ€™s the only one that lets you join the celebration in the Grand Parade moving along the streets of Aalborg and ending in Kildeparken.

posts.title: Sao Paulo Carnival
posts.content: Get ready to Samba at the Sao Paulo carnival days before the beginning of Lent. What started with a handful of Samba schools back in the fifties has now evolved into a spectacular culmination of festivities. It draws millions of tourists and locals to one of the biggest festivals, often considered as a worthy rival to the Rio Carnival. Vamos a bailar!

posts.title: Saint Patrickâ€™s Festival
posts.content: Saint Patrickâ€™s is a unique and dynamic 5-day festival hosted by the city of Dublin that showcases the rich cultural heritage of Ireland. Explore the best of music, art, literature, and spoken word amid hundreds of performances, food events, and tours in the capital city. While youâ€™re there, donâ€™t miss out on signature St. Patrickâ€™s drinks and eats before you wander about painting the town green!

posts.title: Edinburgh Festival Fringe
posts.content: Often regarded as a prominent platform for people to express their acumen for creativity, the Edinburgh Fringe Festival can be your next exclusive travel destination. This modern-day pinnacle of arts and cultural festivities runs for 3 weeks every August. It features some of the most popular names in the entertainment world and is also a stage for budding performers. From dance, music, and physical theater to spoken word, opera, and exhibitions, you can find every entertainment form here.

posts.title: Oktoberfest
posts.content: Hosted by the city of Munich, Bavaria, Oktoberfest is a celebration of sumptuous German street food and drinks. Millions of people flock to the bustling metropolis to devour delicious traditional recipes like sausages, roast pork, roasted fish, pretzels, potato dumplings, and cheese noodles. The great food is also accompanied by amusement rides, games, and market stalls, along with an extensive selection of beers that pair well with the meats.

posts.title: La Tomatina
posts.content: When a group of young boys went to attend the entourage parade in the town of Bunol in 1945, a participant fell down. Getting upset, he began hitting everyone in his path, and a nearby vegetable stall being the epicenter of the chaos led to a tomato fight. In subsequent years, the locals carried tomatoes from their homes to participate in La Tomatina as it gained popularity. Head to Bunol for an intense, fun, and priceless experience at the now-annual festival held on the last Wednesday of August. Didnâ€™t expect us to end with a dose of history, did you?

title: Jaw-Dropping Scenes from Netflixâ€™s Latest Hit, Money Heist
desc:
Canâ€™t get enough of Money Heist and its characters? Here are some of our (maybe even yours) most favorite scenes along with some interesting facts.
 
 
 
 With the recent release of the latest season, Netflixâ€™s Money Heist is all we can talk about. The Dali Gang members take you on a whirlwind journey that leaves your blood pumping with adrenaline and heart wanting for more. Now, as we all pine for season 5, eager to know about their fate, itâ€™s a good time to revisit some of the best moments of the series. We have also put light on some facts about the characters we have come to love.
 
 #SpoilerAlert

posts.title: Dali. Munch. Whatâ€™s next?
posts.content: Did you know, the Salvador Dali masks and red jumpsuits are in line with the showâ€™s anti-fascist theme? They are both symbolic of standing against anarchy, socialist, and communist movements. It's when the heisters replace Dali with Munch masks, that the police panic and abort their stealth mission.

posts.title: The Professor mastered the art of disguise
posts.content: The plan was threatened when a simple mistake on Helsinki's part led to an unforeseen dilemma. The Professor managed to escape in the nick of time and his transformation left us speechless. His astounding acting skills proved that his five auditions didn't go in vain.

posts.title: Some predicaments can be solved by coffee
posts.content: As Raquel's mother and Professor sit over coffee, there's more at stake than just first impressions. Originally, along with Berlin and Raquelâ€™s mother, all other heisters were also supposed to have terminal illnesses, which partly was the motivation of the heist.

posts.title: Why so serious?
posts.content: As the Professor and Raquel sit looking through postcards planning for a vacation, a colored strand of hair throws shade on their sunny beach plans. Fun fact, the beach at the end of the season is not the Philippines. Itâ€™s just a Madrid beach with special CGI effects.

posts.title: Back with a bang!
posts.content: Tokyoâ€™s return to the mint is thrilling, but it soon turns deadly due to Moscow's death. Ãšrsula CorberÃ³â€™s character is among the favorites, but it wasnâ€™t crafted from scratch. Well, it's another â€œBack with a Bang" moment. It was inspired by Natalie Portmanâ€™s Matilda from LÃ©on.

posts.title: Berlin says "Bella, Ciao!"
posts.content:
As the rest of the Dali Gang escaped to safety, Berlin said goodbye a little too early to give his comrades the advantage of those precious minutes. However, the show was originally supposed to end with Berlinâ€™s death. Thanks to Netflix, the show had a different fate.
 #HappyTears

posts.title: Palermo gets almost blind
posts.content: Gandia manages to injure Palermo quite badly, sending the Professor and the gang in a panic situation. The stakes were so high and dramatic as he was to lead the heist. Fun fact, Palermo (Rodrigo de la Serna) also played Alberto Granado in The Motorcycle Diaries.

posts.title: If only climbing trees could save lives
posts.content: Professor runs through the forest trying to save his lover, but two gunshots later, all hope and happiness gets obliterated. Itziar ItuÃ±o who plays the no-nonsense officer Raquel has been working in the Spanish industry for 20 years, and Money Heist was her first huge break.

posts.title: Cute teddy bears can be deadly, isnâ€™t it?
posts.content: Sierra knows how to use the Dali members' emotional weaknesses against them. Her orders for Nairobi to be shot left us at the edge of our seats desperately wanting us to know more. Actresses who play Nairobi and Sierra have previously worked together in Locked Up.

posts.title: Helsinki hanging between death and life, quite literally
posts.content: Gandia hung Helsinki with a rope and Tokyo rushed over to save him. That's heart-racing, high-stakes action for you right there! Fun fact, the Serbian actor who plays Helsinki teaches QiGong masterclasses all over the world. You can sign up for his classes as well.

posts.title: Sierra relentlessly screws the government
posts.content: Money Heist is known for its varied ensemble of strong-headed women. Sierra manages to stick out as she stands in front of the press to incriminate the government. This shows how unpredictable and unprecedented she is. FYI, Najwa Nimri is also a talented singer.

posts.title: La Puta Ama
posts.content: Nairobi was the most stable member of the gang. Her death was harrowing and brutal. She was La Puta Ama (the effinâ€™ boss) and she went like one! Alba Flores was the only original cast member who didn't have to audition for her role.

title: Keep Your Kids Occupied With These Awesome, Engaging Activities
desc:
With the spread of the coronavirus becoming a global health concern, millions are stuck inside their homes. The unprecedented lockdown might be adding to your worries over your kidâ€™s learning coming to a screeching halt.
 With the schools shut, kids now have more time to kill, but without any play dates. You might have a lot of work, but will that be happening if the kids are bored? Your work schedules might not match their hunger cries, and they might barge into the room while you're on a conference call. To keep the awkward moments at bay, you need to ensure that your kids are engaged and entertained. Here are some activities to keep your kids occupied at home. Not to mention, they might even bring out the child in you!

posts.title: Practice mindfulness
posts.content: Mindfulness is important to ensure that you all stay in a positive frame of mind. Practicing mindfulness with your children will help you all stay calm during these trying times and will ensure that you lead healthy lives. It will help you stay positive through the tough times and will also keep the atmosphere at home joyous, calm, and motivated.

posts.title: Pick a schedule
posts.content: Kidsâ€™ lives revolve around their school timings and the amount of playtime they get to squeeze in later. Now that thereâ€™s no school to start the day early, donâ€™t go down a rabbit hole. Plan a schedule with your kids that will enable them to work on their strengths and weaknesses. Include time for a variety of activities like learning, playing, creative tasks, cooking, and even some letâ€™s-do-nothing breaks.

posts.title: Household chores
posts.content: Kids are eager to learn with you if you let them. Assign them tasks that help make your work easier and make them feel proud of themselves. This will occupy your kids for a while, let them learn simple chores, and also make them responsible. Start small with things like letting them make their own cereal bowl or their own bed, sort out laundry, or even organize their wardrobe.

posts.title: Workout together
posts.content: You might hate the idea of running or jumping, but your kid will love it, even if itâ€™s without good reason. Kids are happy when they get to bounce and prance around, so use this energy and design a kid-friendly workout routine for them. Join them for simple stretches or breathing exercises, teach them swimming (if you have a pool), or just ask them to jump on a trampoline.

posts.title: Spend quality time as a family
posts.content: Some days, by the time you get home after work, all you want is a giant drink and your comfy mattress. Now that youâ€™re home, you can put all the saved commute time to good use. Set aside family time in your daily schedule, and do not miss out on it. Catch up with your relatives and ensure that your kids get to know their extended family as well.

posts.title: Read abook
posts.content: Children donâ€™t always need to have their noses stuck in history and math workbooks, and this is a great opportunity to get them hooked to reading outside their syllabus. Pick a book suitable for their age and watch them devour one book after another. To make things interesting, you can check out Storytime From Space, where astronauts read stories while afloat in space!

posts.title: Get Creative
posts.content: Plan a fun slot in your schedule and pick out fun, creative activities that can keep your kids engaged and away from boredom. You can share your hobbies with each other, experiment with cool internet tricks, try your hand at painting, or one up your art with foam painting. You can even design a scavenger hunt for the weekends and race through the house to win.

posts.title: Visit a Museum Virtually
posts.content: Being locked up in the house can be uneventful, and it probably also put your plans of visiting a museum on the weekend to rest. Well, thatâ€™s where technology comes in! You can visit several museums in the country without leaving your house. Thanks to webcams, you can now take a virtual tour of the Louvre museum, the Boston Childrenâ€™s Museum, or many others on your to-visit list.

posts.title: Get Cleaning
posts.content: Now that weâ€™re home, itâ€™s a good enough opportunity to catch up on all the cleaning that we cannot seem to find time or energy for. While you clean out all the vents and sinks, get your kids to help with dusting and cleaning the furniture. Gear up as a team and clean, declutter, and sanitize the house. And while you are at it, donâ€™t forget to clean the equipment.

posts.title: Enjoy gardening
posts.content: Gardening can be fun, especially if you involve the kids. Teach them the basics of gardening and ask them to help you with watering the plants, picking out weeds, or even selecting the seeds to sow. Itâ€™s a great way to spend time with your kids while they learn something new. It will help you destress, and youâ€™ll have a beautiful garden by the end of the lockdown period.

posts.title: Dance Party
posts.content: Everyone loves dancing, right from kids to seniors, so take to dancing to break the monotony of daily life. Not only will it get you hearty laughter but will also help kids get over the fear of performing for an audience. You might even end up learning some dope dance moves from your kid. Add to that the physical activity the kids are getting, and you have an all-round activity!

posts.title: Board Games
posts.content: Break the spines of all the board games you have stashed in a lonesome corner. Your kids can no longer have play dates with their mates, so sub for their friends; teach them games like chess and scrabble or lose to them at monopoly. Board games are a good means of developing healthy competition and can teach kids how to be a good sport.

posts.title: Lego Architecture
posts.content: A kidâ€™s mind is the most creative place, and what better way to nurture it than to bring out the lego sets? Your kids can build forts and machines with something as simple as legos as it helps them put their thoughts into figures. Encourage them to try out new stuff as this game can also help build their problem-solving abilities.

posts.title: Puzzles
posts.content: Back when video games were still a luxury, one of the best indoor activities was solving puzzles. Let the brain cells tingle again with the excitement of putting together multiple tiny pieces to form one picture. And if your kid is already a pro at it, up the ante by getting them to solve a puzzle with more pieces. This can help develop their perseverance and problem-solving abilities.

posts.title: Science Kits
posts.content: Science is a complex subject; too many atoms, too many reactions, and too many organs, but experiments are what make it interesting. Put your science kits to good use and watch your kids getting fascinated with each experiment. If you do not have access to science kits, look for easy at-home science experiments online. Get your goggles out and follow Bill Nye The Science Guy.

posts.title: Costumes
posts.content: Play dress up with your kids or enact plays and stories for entertainment. Host costume parties among yourselves and play your favorite character. Even better, create your own! Have dinner parties with your most-loved fictional friends, or hold a fancy dress competition in the family. You can get everyone involved, facetime friends or cousins, and let the kids decide the costumes they would like to put on before the show!

posts.title: Cooking
posts.content: Get your kids to help you around the kitchen. Ask them which of their favorite dishes they would like to have and teach them to cook it. Your kid will surely love the idea of cooking their favorite recipe. You can also bake cakes and brownies with them. Not only will you have taught your kids something useful but youâ€™ll also have all the delicious food to feast on.

posts.title: Indoor Games
posts.content: Make space inside the house for some fun indoor games. Teach your kids all the games you grew up playing. Turn your dining table into a tennis table or an air hockey table. You can also carve a makeshift foosball from a cardboard box. Make time for games that allow your kids to stay active and engaged. You can even pull out those video games once in a while.

posts.title: Home School
posts.content: Being away from school does not mean kids have to stop learning, so donâ€™t let your kids' academic development take a hit. Set some time aside to help your kids with their motor skills and encourage them to get better at the subjects they find difficult. You are your kidâ€™s best teacher. Use this extra time with them to boost their self-confidence and help them cope well with studies.

posts.title: Remote Learning
posts.content: Get your kid involved in online learning activities. Various resources online will help you with your curricular, and some of them even provide downloadable worksheets that will help you practice what you learn. You can also learn extracurricular activities like drawing and doodling. There couldnâ€™t be a better time to start with lessons on the musical instruments your kid wishes to learn too.

posts.title: Learn Animals
posts.content: Use the time at home for bird watching, and list all the animals and birds in your locality. If thereâ€™s not a lot of greenery around you, switch to visiting zoos and aquariums digitally. Enjoy your virtual trips, minus the crowd. Learn about animals while visiting the Cincinnati or the San Diego Zoo, and watch with fascination as the sharks from the Monterey Bay Aquarium swim around with no worries.

posts.title: National Parks
posts.content: The country has a wide range of National Parks situated all across, and these definite go-to spots have their unique features. Joshua Tree National Park in California, Everglades National Park in Florida, Grand Canyon National Park in Arizona, and Grand Teton National Park in Wyoming have all switched on their webcams. Put your Google maps to good use and tick them off your kidsâ€™ bucket list.

posts.title: Write Letters
posts.content: Letter writing is an art that has gotten lost in time. Put your kidâ€™s lingual skills to use and teach them the art of letter writing. You can even save these letters and teach kids how to post them when you can finally set foot out of the house. The writing process can help your kid articulate their thoughts better and can also help improve their vocabulary.

posts.title: Dig out the Memories
posts.content: Dig out old photographs and enjoy a stroll down the memory lane. Sit back and regale the stories of your childhood as you get your kids acquainted with your childhood. You can also recount stories of old trips you all took together and ask the kids to pitch in. You might end up with memories you had forgotten along the way; not to mention, youâ€™ll make new ones too.

posts.title: Learn a new language
posts.content: Learning a new language is a surefire way to be productive. Get your kid signed up for online classes that can teach them a language of their choice, and you can also get them to teach it to you. This can be beneficial for both of you as you will have a new skill to boast of by the end of the lockdown period.

title: Mother's Day Posts You Can't Help but Relate To
desc:
Motherâ€™s day is almost here and if youâ€™ve forgotten what shenanigans you put her through, these sassy and true Instagram posts will definitely remind you.
 
 Considering how sometimes we cannot even move a finger right without our mothers, it is absurd how often we forget to give them proper thanks. Moms are funny, beautiful, and empowering. Sure you may fight with them for not understanding your music choices but your relationship is more than just squabbles. This is the perfect time for you to reminisce about your bond with these funny and endearing posts that sum it up. Donâ€™t forget to call and remind her that you are her favorite kid, or as she says, favorite financial burden! But, you know, tomayto - tomahto!

posts.title: Truth bomb #1
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Now that we've been trapped at home with our kids for the past couple of weeks, I feel the urge to share this letter board post. It makes me giggle every time I see it because there's no such thing as relaxing when you're a parent. And now that we've been juggling parenting, working, keeping up with house chores and whatnot, there's ABSOLUTELY zero relaxing happening. But although it's tough as hell, I wouldn't have it any other way. I know I won't get to spend this much time with Luna ever again. So I try to remind myself of that every single day. But let me know... do you have time to relax? . . . . . #motherhoodthroughletterboards #motherhoodthroughig #canadianmommyblogger #canadianmoms #canadianmom #montrealblogger #montrealmom #funnymoms #momssupportingmoms #momswhorun #workingmoms #workingmomlife #badmoms #parentingquotes #funnyparents #motherhoodinspired

This is one thought every mother has. Letâ€™s face it, moms around the globe donâ€™t get enough credit, but they also definitely donâ€™t get enough sleep. Every time they close their eyes, something comes up that only they can deal with!

posts.title: Reevaluate your memories
posts.content:
View this post on Instagram

Every. single. day. ????????????????// via @notsomumsy

A post shared by bloom (@bloomglobal) on May 4, 2020 at 3:01pm PDT

Remember all the times you dragged your mother out of the kitchen to play with you? Then you went ahead and wailed about dinner not being ready on time? Yeah, you really were not the golden child you thought you were.

posts.title: *Stretches..cracks a bone* Needed that
posts.content:

title: Movie Details You Almost Definitely Totally Missed
desc: Some movies are worth watching only once, while there are others that you can't stop rewatching, sometimes just for scenes that make a lasting impression. Having said that, how often do you notice the intricate details and painstaking efforts taken by filmmakers to ensure continuity? We bring you thirty easter eggs and instances of attention-to-detail in movies that you might have missed.

posts.title: Hatâ€™s off!
posts.content: When Davy Jonesâ€™s ship is about to go under in Pirates of the Caribbean, you can see him hold on to his hat with his tentacles. Donâ€™t blink as you might just miss this amazing attention to detail.

posts.title: Darker intros â€“ Harry Potter
posts.content: From The Sorcererâ€™s Stone to the second part of The Deathly Hallowsâ€“ Part 2, the intro animation of Warner Bros pictures, the movie title, and the background changed color to a darker shade. Now thatâ€™s called staying true to a plot that gets darker with each movie!

posts.title: The canyons are cars
posts.content: You might have missed out on a little detail in Pixarâ€™s Cars. The canyons in the background are part of the fictional town of Radiator Springs inspired by the iconic Route 66 and are also shaped like old cars and hood ornaments.

posts.title: Pulp Fiction predicts Kill Bill
posts.content: Remember the conversation Uma Thurman has with John Travolta in a restaurant where her lines reference specific characters of Kill Bill? Thatâ€™s how Quentin Tarantino masterfully included references to the characters of Kill Bill in Pulp Fiction.

posts.title: The Lord Al-Mighty himself
posts.content: A very subtle and easy-to-miss detail concerning Morgan Freeman in Evan Almighty, his name tag spells â€œAl Mightyâ€ when he poses as a waiter to tend to Evanâ€™s family. Now thatâ€™s what you call paying close attention to detail.

posts.title: The time when Titanic sank
posts.content: The mighty Titanic sank at 2.20 am, which is also the time on the wall clock when Jack (Leonardo DiCaprio) greets Rose (Kate Winslet) at the stairs the last time. The clock is shown at crucial points throughout the movie.

posts.title: The garbage man from Toy Story
posts.content: We all hated Sid from Toy Story as only he maimed toys throughout the movie. Interestingly, in the third sequel of the franchise, Sid made a cameo appearance as a trash collector in the same skull T-shirt he wore as a kid.

posts.title: Bruce Wayneâ€™s car
posts.content: Bruce Wayne drives a Lamborghini MurciÃ©lago in The Dark Knight, but it isnâ€™t a mere coincidence that MurciÃ©lago is actually Spanish for the word â€œBatâ€.

posts.title: Longbottomâ€™s cloak
posts.content: In Harry Potter and the Sorcererâ€™s Stone, Neville Longbottom canâ€™t remember what he forgot after the Remembrall turns red. Yet, you can see that he is the only one without his cloak in the scene.

posts.title: Weasleyâ€™s robes
posts.content: We all know that the Weasleys could not afford to buy new clothes for all their younger children. Paying a little attention to Ronâ€™s robes reveals that they are old and faded as they are hand-me-downs, belonging to one of his brothers.

posts.title: Auto takes over in Wall-E
posts.content: When the camera pans across the portraits of all the captains of the Axiom posing with the autopilot (Auto), you can see Auto getting closer in each portrait. This represents the AIâ€™s gradual takeover of Axiom.

posts.title: Andy Dusfreneâ€™s hammer
posts.content: All inmates get a new Bible when they first come to Shawshank. If you look closely, Andy Dusfrene hides the small rock hammer in the Book of Exodus, which tells the story of the escape of Jews from Egypt. This is discovered by the warden after Dusfrene escapes.

posts.title: The same color scheme
posts.content: This one is a little difficult to spot as close-up shots of the car are shown only for a couple of seconds at the beginning of Guardians of the Galaxy Vol.2. Yet, pay careful attention and youâ€™ll see that both Egoâ€™s car and Peter Quillâ€™s spaceship are of the same color scheme.

posts.title: Captain Americaâ€™s shield
posts.content: Marvel fans did not miss Captain Americaâ€™s shield lying on Tony Starkâ€™s workbench in the first Iron Man movie. It is also why the producers had to show it again in the new element discovery scene in the sequel.

posts.title: Christmas tree compass
posts.content: The Christmas tree in The Polar Express is placed at the center of compass markings, but thatâ€™s not all. An interesting detail that you might have missed is that every point on the massive dial points South.

posts.title: Jurassic dilemma
posts.content: The movie follows a storyline of dinosaurs bred with female reproductive organs only. This is made evident with symbolism in the shot where Dr. Grant ties up his seat belt that has both female locking mechanisms.

posts.title: Well done Forrest!
posts.content: Forrest Gump defends his long-time love interest, Jenny, by beating up her boyfriend one night. In an amazing example of maintaining continuity, there are bruises on his knuckles the next morning.

posts.title: Sandman loses his teeth
posts.content: Watch it in slow motion, and youâ€™ll be surprised to know that Sandmanâ€™s teeth donâ€™t grind off like the rest of his face. Instead, they fly right out his mouth when Spiderman pushes his face against the train in Spider-Man 3.

posts.title: School of Rock
posts.content: In School of Rock, Dewey Finn (Jack Black) is so obsessed with rock and roll that his blackboard pointer stick also has a tiny hand at the end, which is shaped to represent the rock and roll gesture.

posts.title: Bee beautiful
posts.content: The Bee Movie gave audiences an up-close and personal view of the world of bees. Even so, you might question exactly how close you looked if you missed out on noticing that almost all male bees have the â€œbuzz cutâ€ hairstyle.

posts.title: Floored
posts.content: It gets challenging at this point as you must pay attention to two movies. The pattern on the carpet in Overlook Hotel in The Shining is identical to the one in Sidâ€™s room in Toy Story.

posts.title: Lucky shape
posts.content: Did you notice that the pup named Lucky from 101 Dalmatians sports spots in a horseshoe pattern? It's no coincidence that he was named lucky, as the horseshoe is considered to be a symbol of luck.

posts.title: Hostage situation
posts.content: Tony Stark was kidnapped by a group of extremists called Ten Rings in the first Iron Man movie. Interestingly, the same group was under the Mandarinâ€™s control in the third installment of the franchise. The similarities are evident in the groupâ€™s identity poster hung in the background, later shown as the interlude screen before one of their broadcasts.

posts.title: Docâ€™s clocks
posts.content: Everyone knows that Doc hangs from the Hill Valley clock tower in Back to the Future. Having said that, you might have missed the small merchandise with a man hanging off a clock in the scene that shows Docâ€™s setup, foreshadowing the actual scene in the movie.

posts.title: Amazing continuity
posts.content: John Wick and John Wick 2 were filmed and released three years apart, but all the cars outside the Continental Hotel remain the same. Talk about flawless continuity!

posts.title: What a prop!
posts.content: You would think a multi-million dollar budget would let the production crew use all the props they needed for filming. Yet, the makers of Star Trek used a Dyson hand dryer as a sci-fi prop. Too bad for them as several attentive movie fans caught it!

posts.title: Apples for roses
posts.content: Did you know that throwing an apple to a woman you like was considered a proposal in ancient Greece? Well, the makers of Aladdin certainly account for this little detail in one of their magic carpet rides over Greece, where Aladdin tosses an apple to Jasmine.

posts.title: Reddingâ€™s mugshot
posts.content: For a mugshot in Ellis Boyd Reddingâ€™s prison file in The Shawshank Redemption, a photograph of Morgan Freemanâ€™s son, Alfonso, was used instead of a photo of a young Freeman. Thatâ€™s something you would miss unless you follow the actorâ€™s life closely.

posts.title: Pun intended indeed
posts.content: If you came across a Hyena Gomez, Kanine West, or even Gazelle and also understood what they stood for, you watched Zootopia quite closely indeed. These were animal-centric pun names used based on the actual singersâ€™ names in the iPod scene.

posts.title: Snape knows
posts.content: Harryâ€™s scar hurt in The Sorcererâ€™s Stone when Snape looked at him while talking to professor Quirrell during the Welcoming Feast. While everyone thought the scar was hurting because of Snape, it turns out that the good professor knew about the connection right from the beginning.

title: Musings of a Bored Mind
desc:
Quarantining and boredom are the new norms. We donâ€™t know if your brain is a devilâ€™s workshop yet, but we're sure that youâ€™re having these random thoughts!
 While we are all maintaining social distancing, it has become increasingly difficult to break the monotony that the pandemic has brought on in our lives. It has also become impossible to not hate staying indoors. The only saving grace is the Internet, and might we add, our wandering thoughts. As much as we would like to have some life-changing realizations, letâ€™s be honest, our brains have turned to mush. And instead of epiphanies, the random thoughts that crop up have now become the fabric of our lives.
 
 Here are some random thoughts that we all have while weâ€™re stuck at home:

posts.title: What day is it?
posts.content: Ah, yes! We finally get why time is an illusion. As we stay indoors, observing social distancing, it really does not matter if it is a weekday or a weekend. Our home is now our college, office, and pretty much our existence at the moment.

posts.title: To cook or not to cook
posts.content: Pampering yourself by cooking an extravagant spread is cool and all, but the thought of chopping vegetables, â€œactually cookingâ€, and cleaning the mess makes cooking an ordeal. So, as expected, the BOGO offer from a local pizzeria seems more appetizing than ever. Relatable much?

posts.title: Letâ€™s showerâ€¦... tomorrow
posts.content: This is yet another daily routine that most of us may find unnecessary now that we donâ€™t venture out that often. Having said that, what is more daunting is the fact that you will have to shower someday! The horror!

posts.title: Video call or audio call?
posts.content: It has been over a month since you have called your friends, which means that you need to get in touch with them ASAP. But what about your perpetual â€œno-shave Novemberâ€ face? So now, of course, youâ€™re second-guessing your decision to video call them.

posts.title: Window shopping. More like â€œIâ€™ll buy it laterâ€ shopping
posts.content: The Internet is filled with things we want to buy. â€œI see it, I like it, I want it.â€ Unfortunately, we canâ€™t buy it because our bank balance wonâ€™t allow it. So, what do we do? We stare at our cart.

posts.title: Does this smell funny?
posts.content: Itâ€™s been three weeks. The clothes in the laundry basket are piling up. Can they sit there for another day, or is it time to toss them in the washing machine? Whatever you do, we hope you donâ€™t wear them without washing them first.

posts.title: Itâ€™s time to travelâ€¦..mentally
posts.content: One of the best things that you might miss is ticking off those destinations on your bucket list. Even though thatâ€™s not possible now, you can always think about your next trip and dream about a future that is full of travel.

posts.title: The hairy monster strikes again!
posts.content: As much as we would like to rock the â€œmessy look,â€ our hair isnâ€™t always our best friend and has a personality of its own. This means that we either have to learn how to groom ourselves or make peace with looking like Hagrid.

posts.title: Time to install that fitness app and never use it
posts.content: The instructor in the fitness app looks like a Greek god or goddess. Itâ€™s totally understandable that you want to look like one too. Itâ€™s also understandable that you want to choose a life of a couch potato two minutes into the workout.

posts.title: I can develop a skill or two. The question is, should I?
posts.content: Mandarin sounds cool, but so does French. May be catching up on those guitar lessons will make the days less boring. All these productive thoughts can take up a lot of brainpower. After this tete-a-tete with yourself, you realize youâ€™re better off without any skills.

posts.title: Now I know why my dog is always excited to go out
posts.content: One of the most relatable thoughts is that your dog is always elated to go out for a run. Being holed up in one place has taught us how joyous simple things like taking a stroll can be.

posts.title: Is it time to clean the house?
posts.content: As our furniture gathers a new layer of dust, we wonder if itâ€™s absolutely necessary to get up from our bed and clean the house. Unfortunately, it is necessary. If the pandemic doesnâ€™t get us, our allergies most definitely will. On that note, tidy up!

title: Pet-friendly Vacation Destinations Your Furry Friend Will Love
desc: If you love going on vacations but cannot bear to leave your beloved furball at home, fret not! There are several incredible places in the country where your dog can tag along with you. It can be tough finding a hotel or local cafe that lets your pooch wander around without inhibitions. So, here are some amazing pet-friendly vacation destinations where your furry friend is welcomed whole-heartedly. All you have to do is pack up some amazing treats, your furballâ€™s favorite treats, a strong leash, and bid adieu to your normal routine and embark on a journey that will be memorable not just for you, but also for your pet.

posts.title: Asheville, North Carolina
posts.content: If you wanted to embark on a weekend getaway and relax in a cabin in the lush greenery, Asheville is where you should be headed. Itâ€™s a great place for those who wish to travel with their pooches as Asheville has its share of canine tourists. In fact, there are over 200 acres of grounds for your dog to run around at the Biltmore Estate. Thereâ€™s also an onsite kennel to park your pooch when you tour the historic house. Do you wish to cool off? If yes, then visit the French Broad River Dog Park, which is a fenced-off, wood-chipped acre for your pup to run around and even has a river to splash around!

posts.title: Atlanta, Georgia
posts.content: Atlanta is a place where all dogs live happily. For starters, there is a lot of running space such as Piedmont Dog Park, which is a designated off-leash area. If your pupper is smaller than the others, thereâ€™s a separate space for smaller animals as well. Pets are welcome almost everywhere, including Freedom Park! You can take your pooch along to discover the peaceful Chattahoochee River National Recreation Park together. Your pup can take a refreshing nap in one of the pet-friendly rentals while you hit the incredible bars and restaurants that have Atlanta buzzing all day long.

posts.title: Key West, Florida
posts.content: Without further ado, introduce your pooch to the fun life in Key West, Florida. The Key West Dog Beach is where your best friend can have some off-leash fun and play in the waves without any interruption. If you wish to get out on the water with your dog, Lazy Dog Kayak is there to accommodate your wishes. You can enjoy the scenic beach while you and your doggie paddle along. If all these fun activities make you hungry, order fresh seafood in at Nine One Five Bistro and enjoy the view with your pooch together on the dog-friendly terrace.

posts.title: San Francisco, California
posts.content: Your fluff can accompany you to San Francisco for the community there is open to travelers who are accompanied by their pets. You wonâ€™t have to worry about leaving your pet alone while finding a nice place for brunch as there are more than 50 restaurants where your pet is as welcome as you are. If you love wine, try Mutt Lynch Winery where your pooch can tag along with you. Even Blue and Gold Fleet Bay Cruises and the cityâ€™s famous cable cars have no qualms about having pets onboard.

posts.title: Portland, ME
posts.content: Your pet can accompany you while you explore Portland. Not only does Portland tolerate pups, but they also genuinely welcome your pets to stroll with you as you walk on the lovely cobbled streets of the Old Port. Pooches are so popular with the residents there that you will find many water bowls set out to welcome them. Your furry friend can even accompany you on a scenic cruise around the offshore island aboard the Casco Bay Mailboat. All you have to do is keep your dog on a leash!

posts.title: San Diego, California
posts.content: The residents of San Diego will pose absolutely no problem if you arrive with your furry friend. Do you want to know why? Well, it would be an understatement to say that they love dogs! You can lunch at the Patio on Lamont at Pacific Beach and share the delicious Californian cuisine with your pooch. In fact, your pup can savor home-made dog biscuits as well! You can also take your dog to a dog-friendly terrace at Pier CafÃ© on West Harbor Drive. Your dog doesnâ€™t have to miss its daily visit to the dog park just because you are on a vacation. You can take them to Nateâ€™s Point Off-Leash Dog Park at Balboa Park or let them explore the dunes and surf of Fiesta Island.

posts.title: Wilmington, North Carolina
posts.content: Hereâ€™s a historic city located by the beach which is the perfect vacation destination if you wish to bring your doggo along. You guys can pay a visit to Halyburton Park and make the most of its beautiful walking trails. If you want to let your pooch play in the water and run around freely, drive to Freeman Park, which is a large dog-friendly beach. If you wish to relax, your pooch can tag along to visit The Java Dog Coffee House, which as the name suggests, is a dog-friendly spot and a great cafe with an artsy ambiance.

posts.title: Golden Isles, Georgia
posts.content: You wonâ€™t have to feel guilty about leaving your pets behind if you choose your Golden Isles in Georgia as your next vacation destination.
